You can wait immediately at the drive-up, there's enough space for you to wait safely and for the driver to stop just behind you. The first person passing gave me a lift.
Not the best spot, cars go fast and not enough place to stop
On a race three teams left in a total of 5 minutes with 3 different cars. was really easy.
Good spot to head East.

I stayed in one of the parking places for cars near the sidewalk but it must have a place for a car to park for you. I stayed on this street SchwarzwaldstraÃŸe 20, right before the turn near the bridge. Got a ride in 5 min to Villinden Schwenningen
Stood there for almost 2 hours but very early sunday morning, maybe more the time than the spot...

Good spot! Huge gasstation with restaurant and kiosk. A lot of people that travel far stop there for a break and it is very busy. We stayed not at the gasstation but a bit behind where the road makes a curve. Easy to stop and cars go slow. Got a ride to Munich directly.
Safe Gas station, Ksenia took as to Stuttgart
good spot, took us a while though to get a ride to Munich as a couple
Very good to continue south on A9. I got a ride to Munich in 40 mins.
Also found a ride direct to Munich pretty quickly. And theres free wifi in the lofted cafe and burger king.
Some people from Dresden asked us if we wanted to join. We were 2 people. Alot of Chech cars too.

This spot had a surprising amount of people even at 8 pm. We had only asked a couple of drivers of we could hitch a ride to Dresden before we were approached and offered a ride. We saw a lot of families stopping here, so finding a ride as a pair could be more difficult.
10 minutes and to dresden, pretty sweet
1 and half to dresden
It is a little, normaally frequented place. The people here are nice and usually go direction Dresden, you don't have to ask often. Once I had a good experience here
Great spot. After a few minutes I got offered some rides. Didnt even take an hour to get to bremen.
Go BEYOND the traffic lights: there's a space where cars can stop on the ramp itself.

I stand one and a half houer. A lot of People drive to Bremen..
When it is rainy the people dont want too stopped.!
first try i stood for about 90 minutes before getting a ride. second time i stood for about 3 hours and noone stopped.
looked like a awsome spot but took over 1 hour to get a ride to the gas station on the highway, and thats with a sign BH (bremen)
Got a ride towards Munich really quickly here. It is easy to get here with public transport.

Not in direction West! For that I suggest the other motorway entrances in Western Stuttgart (e.g. Vaihingen) Local people told us the same, too. But all in all, a good spot with many local cars which go about 50 km from here to South or East (on the highway). We got a ride in 15 minutes even on Saturday evening 11:30pm! 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), Saturday, 15 mins
Waited 40 min. with a "MÃœNCHEN / AUGSBURG" sign and got a ride directly to Augsburg where I wanted to go. Only good to get a ride south (B27) or east (A8).
Just before the double lane starts, there's a  cool  spot (bus stop) where cars are still going slow. Waited 1 hour to Ulm (with a Munich sign) a sunday morning
Its a good spot for going east or south, but not for going direction Karlsruhe. Senseless.
Some nice couple taked us in the moment when we was there
Good place if you want to go north or south on the A5.
I got a ride a little bit after Kaiserslautern. Not so high traffic, but can work!
When you are travelling west, it is best to ask drivers to take you to the next station in hockenheim.
When in need of food don't forget to go to the nearest Lidl just about the roundabout - much cheaper than on the gas station! Ask lorry drivers if you can't find it.
Mostly local license plates and full Dutch holiday-goers. Found a Belgian couple eventually
Found some french people that could drop me to baden baden. Good gastation to continue further south after.
After an hour in the evening i accept a ride north even though i wanted to go south. Because then I could stop at Bruchsal and try going south from there, without all the people for north.
A perfect spot or gas station if youâ€™re heading to southwest Germany. Donâ€™t hesitate to ask driversâ€”I managed to get a ride all the way to a place nearby Kaiserslautern.

This exact spot, in the curve when two exits meet, is only for North! South exit is at the other end of the station. Walk around and read the boards carefully first! Huge resting area, filling station plus restaurant, but few cars stopped for us. Nearly impossible to get to France with one ride from here, none of the French drivers gave us a lift. Accept offers to Karlsruhe!
2 persons (me & my girlfriend), Sunday, dir. France, 2 hours.
Lots of traffic, lots of trucks - good spot.
This place is not very busy... only few cars going by. It was worth the wait though and I got a direct ride to Amsterdam after 1 and a half hours.
No Problem to Cologne, hard to find someone to go on A48 to the West. Maybe you can find someone for A61 and change direction in Mendig for A48
After 1 minute a Belgian car stopped and the friendly couple took me all the way to Antwerp, right where my bike stood. Thank you very much!
Long rides everywhere! :D
Tried to go west, doesn't work, tool a lift to munich.
Thereâ€™s a roundabout where you can stand with a sign, easy pickup, since the cars are quite slow
I was there again a couple of days ago and got a ride to south of Munich after 40 mins. Very busy place

Southward works perfectly. I thumbed at the end of the gas station, when the road feeds back into the highway. Three people that were walking around the area even spontaneously offered me a ride. The third one was right for me, DIRECTLY to Rome, Italy.
easy to get a ride to munich

Didnâ€™t get a rideâ€¦
Cars go fairly fast and traffic is mostly local out of Lubeck.
I waited for about 20 minutes and then a road worker arrived and told me itâ€™s already part of the highway and I could get in trouble with the police. So I decided to take the bus instead.

Got a ride to Heiligenhafen after 20min standing with a sigh Copenhagen and Puttgarden. People are getting faster to enter the highway but there's some place to stop on the bifurcation right after the little bridge that cross the pedestrian way.

The spot is a bit overgrown but still decent visibility and reaction time for cars. Waited 3 hours for a ride to Puttgarden but no luck. (solo guy, Sunday early evening) Got some offers for places closer but I'm not too sure if it's smart to take them or not. Ended up taking the bus from the main station.
If you go north, don't take a car that does NOT go at least onto Fehmarn island! I t makes things a lot harder. Good spot
We tried to get to Poland using the A38 to Leipzig, but the cars that stopped all wanted to go Northern so we decided to take a lift to Braunschweig and then head Eastern
Great spot to get a ride to GÃ¶ttingen, I would recommend a sign (Norden/ GÃ–) since it worked well for us that way
Nice spot if you want to go both Leipzig or Frankfurt.
Hitchhiked with a sign "A38 Leipzig" at 3 PM and got a ride even to Dresden after 2 minutes.

Two times I hitchhiked from this place. To Frankfurt it took me ~40 minutes and to Leipzig ~
10 minutes waiting time.
Just had to ask 3 people.
Slow traffic, got a ride to Poznan after asking around for an hour.

Most people here go straight onto the A115 into Berlin, so I recommend trying to find a short ride to at least the next gas station, were more people are continuing towards Poznan, Dresden, or Wroclaw.
Shit loads of PL traffic. Easy.
Got lift in direction of Wroclaw easily. Then I guess could be useful to go to Dresden as well.
Lots of local traffic when I was there, but two guys who went to Bremen, took me to the next gas station on the highway.

Very nice spot. A lot of traffic goes by here. Got a ride within 5/10 minutes to Bremen. Better to ask with the people pumping gas but standing at the side of the road with a sign is also fine. Traffic does move fast there though.
Was immediately picked up by guy going to Hannover to pick up some materials. Seems like a good spot, or maybe I was just extremely lucky.

One of the best spots in Hamburg. But for south or west you want to get a short ride to next gas station on the Highway, Autobahn-RaststÃ¤tte Stillhorn, and then look for a good ride.  Next spot has more traffic going more directions.

Morning and evening with commuter traffic is best here.
Waited for just 5min and then got a ride outside the city to another fuel station.
Still a good spot, many open people going for a long ride. Just ask at the petrol station
I hitchhiked twice from this place. First time to Wroclaw (10 min) and second time to GÃ¶rlitz (20 minutes). Both times I asked at the fuel station.
got lift to wroclaw directly to the center for 3 people within 1h. just ask the drivers at the gas station or the parking lots
Got direct lift to Wroclaw. (2 people)
Except sundays, many Polish truck drivers stop here on their way east.
Great spot, got three offers in 25 minutes.
Dont even think of trying to go towards east on A38...imposible :( going towards south however is easy from here :)

within two hours 10 cars stopped and offered me rides to all over southern Germany. Unfortunately I had to go to the countryside but it shows that chances are good to get a lift further down south the A7 from here.
Nice station. Quite crowded, so I found a ride 100km south on the highway after 30 mins :D
same as Licor007. South works great. eastbound is a bit tricky, but it is possible (single traveler asking around on a tuesday afternoon)
Pretty good to get south, although most people were not going far (maybe KÃ¶ln or Dortmund). If you're trying to go further, stay on the A3 at all costs

For a ride to KÃ¶ln perfect.
We tride to go to MÃ¼nchen. Thatâ€™s why we waited so long.
Extremely good spot if you want to get to Cologne but it is difficult to get a lift to A45 and Frankfurt.
Nice place to Koln

We were here by accident, going to Netherlands, but this is definietely not a good spot to go to Netherlands. But apart from that it's a good spot, it has restaurant, big parking and petrol station and a lot of traffic.
back on track after successfull battle of trying to get out of Frankfurt airport. great guy took us south near france border (shoutout Alfred from NY)
Not bad. Got picked up by two charming German students going to Heidelberg. (1 M, 1 F)
Not busy but pretty lucky that a German business man gave us a lift.
Very good spot a lot of people willing to take you.

A bit quiet gas station. A guy who was going to Freidburg picked me up. He ended up driving me all the way into Strasbourg.
Sign said "Strasbourg".
waited for 30 minutes with a sign before i got a lift to hamburg. two times.
waited for two traficlights to get a ride to hamburg...best spot!
waited after the traffic light for about 45 min - got a ride to Walsleben  gasstation, but the guy was going to Rostock.

berlin-hamburg (waited 1 hour)
i walked between the cars when they waited for the green traffic lights

usually cars going to Hamburg are on the left side of the street so its kind of difficult to get the people going in this direction. we had a sign saying hamburg and found after 15min a really cool guy taking us. the traffic lights are really helpful, like this people can stop
Asked around to find someone going to Szczecin, Poland. A bit quiet but most people are going to the east of Germany
Quite a lot of full cars with holiday-goers, but enough traffic atleast! Got a lift that went close to Berlin after around half an hour. A few people were also going North.
Tried to hitch to Hamburg from here. Big mistake. Horrible spot to go north, everyone is going either east or south.
Wanting to go to Hamburg. Declined 3 rides going east. Eventualy changed my plan and accepted a ride to strait to Berlin.
To Wildeshausen raststÃ¤tte.
It was a calm morning but still found a ride close to Frankfurt
I was lucky I found a family who took me to Alicante, spain
It was a bit hard to get to Freiburg on a saturday afternoon. Many people going to Strasbourg, local traffic aswell. After one and a half hour got a lift from a german couple.

Direction South on the A5 towards Basel
Needed 10min to get a ride with two Australian guys who brought me to Freiburg.

Got offered lifts to Karlsruhe, Frankfurt and NÃ¼rnberg within 30 mins. Got a lift to Pforzheim direction Stuttgart after one hour. Friday morning in June. Agree with Mrm1985, if you are coming from south and wanna go to Stuttgart and your driver drives north: This is the place to get off.
nice spot
On a Saturday in July at 1830, okish. 40% eastern european cars. 1 offer to Hamburg. Surprisingly many offers north.
Got a ride to Berlin, the third drivers i asked i got in. Pretty good spot.
Very easy to get from here to Berlin. For Hamburg I waited about an hour in the morning. Towards south rather difficult, at least when it's not rush hour
Not easy to get the ride to the south (direction Hildesheim) but I stopped the car coming from the town by the road beside this petrol station
Stood here 3 hours, no one stopped / asked around 20 people at the Gasstation

Awesome for direction Leipzig. But shouldn't be hard to find someone heading further either. 

In my opinion eg. for going to Leipzig: don't bother with the petrol station and just thumb next to the road. ~Lukas

Gas station with an ok amount of cars. Some going further, although you need some patience for going on the A9 towards Berlin etc.

If you want to go to Leipzig don't bother asking around on the petrol station, but write a sign and stand next to the road. ~Lukas

I was waiting for only 20 min, direction: Berlin, August, Sunday afternoon. You can catche drives from petrol station, but also from the road, on the same spot. I was picked up by Porsche driver, 270 km/h in one moment. Best drive ever. :)
Best spot in town to go up north in direction or to Berlin. Also Magdeburg -> Hannover -> Hamburg e.g.
Not a lot of activity 23:30 on a wednesday. Got picked up by a man going to KÃ¶ln though!
Here I met a Swedish guy who was hitchhiking for the first time to Italy! Managed to hitch a ride together with guys from Kosovo going to Hannover.

Good spot in general, but you have to talk to a lot of people. Perhaps better to just stand with a sign with a road name. Eventually got a lift to MÃ¼nster, which was nice though. If you want to ask people, go by the public bathrooms and gas pumps. If using sign, stand by the exit so everyone will pass you!
Needed to get to Groningen but was asking around for Bremen, got lucky asking a dutch numberplate and gkt a lift all the way to Groningen
Most people going south go to Hanover, but if some going further south as well
Pretty low traffic I would recommand asking  people that stop for gas to increases chances. You can also ask people stopping at Mac Donald's
between 7 and 8 few cars in the direction of hamburg but I managed to take a Tesla

Lovely spot. Friendly people, some local hitchhikers and I quickly got a ride to a rasteplatz near Wittstock (I was going to Rostock, but met people going to Hamburg). According to my ride this used to be one of the two main places to hitchhike from West Berlin to West Germany so you're taking part in history as well as getting a quick ride.
Not much traffic at 7 in the morning. I asked for a ride to Stolpen Heide gas station and found one in 5 minutes.

I have cached a ride all the way to Denmark twice, holding a DK sign. Go a little further down the road from the petrol station to the light right before the highway. I found that it helped. I went between 9 and 10 in the morning on weekends. Got a ride after 30 min.
wonderful view, little windy here, we had a hope for A-81 south, didnt work, so we refused and continued direction Frankfurt, witch worked

I rate it 3/5 for south, for north 4-5/5
After a long time a guy going to Bonn, but we told him to drop us on a highway 3km from Wallau, cuz it was a traffick jam, then we walked to the city

A lot of car going to North A3, but some are traveling south. It took me 2h to wait for direct ride to Freiburg, but then it was very fast ride and directly to the place I need. 
The spot is good, with nice view and not so expensive (relative to other petrol stations). Many foreign car, mostly NL, but some B as well. People are friendly and it is worth to try to speak directly to them. During 2 hours of waiting 4 drivers offer me a ride to north, but I politely declined as there is no better sp
Great spot heading southwest. Lots of traffic even in the early morning.
Going to Frankfurt appeared to be way easier than finding somebody going south but we caught a ride to Stuttgart after about 90 minutes.

Some space to stop but only cars coming from the right will see you, and only those on one lane will be able to stop. Had a sign saying Leipzig, eventually changed for A4 tankstelle, after which I got a ride to Dresdner Tor very fast.
Not the best spot but i guess i got lucky with a quick ride to Chemnitz.
Very bad, nobody stops
Was here for just 5 minutes, getting a direct lift to Chemnitz
Very good place for cars to stop before the highway. There is a traffic lights, not fast speed

The entrance ramp back to the highway is currently closed due to construction. There were no cars at all i left to michendorf. Not sure if itâ€™s cause of that or just a bad day. But it seems like the construction will go on for a while

Best spot to leave Berlin south or west. 
Ask around for rides west or(!) south and respekt common etiquette if there are other hitchhikers. I hitchhiked 15 times from here (mostly alone) and it always worked.
Waiting time 5-90 min.
60% of the time you end up 50km further at a big rest stop in Michendorf where A3 and A9 splits. While there might be another 45 min waiting time awaiting you its still worth it to go there. After Michendorf it will get better!
(25m, white)

I waited here for 2 hours on a Wednesday morning and decided than to leave this place and try it in Michendorf. I think this spot could be good but the problem is that there is not a lot of traffic. Just saw a few cars going to the highway and no one wanted to take me to the south.

Was pessimistic at first because a lot of local license plates, but after half an hour talking to drivers we found a lift to Leipzig! At noonish on a weekday not a lot of traffic on the on-slip though, talking to drivers is the way :-)
First we thought it wouldnâ€™t be a great spot, because we saw many Berlin numberplates. But the first dutch car we saw took us all the way to the Netherlands, maybe we were lucky
Waited for around 30 minutes thumbing at the exit with a Bern sign, until eventually a family saw me from a distance and waved at me to come join them.
Literally the first couple I approached took me almost all the way to Como,Italy
We were hitchhiking from Freiburg South and had to wait around 75 min. ItÂ´s not a really good spot. So if you're going from Freiburg South. Try another option.
I think it is a good place to hitchhike but it was not easy for me to find someone who goes to France. So I ended up in a car to Basel

Often going to France from Freiburg. 
I use bus/tram to get to the spot, then trying to catch a car. Most cars to the south, so finding a French car can take a long time. Stil the best option I found so far to travel Freiburg->France.

Good if you're going to Munich or NÃ¼rnberg. We first tried to get to Regensburg but no luck so eventually we settled on Munich. If you're going to Austria like us, it might be easier to get through Munich and Salzburg than to try and cut across

Okay enough, highway service stations are always quite a good place. I was heading into NÃ¼rnberg, but I arrived in the middle of rush hour and the motorway was a standstill traffic jam. Had a break and then found a car going to MÃ¼nchen. I unfortunately don't speak much German and the driver asked if I had a boyfriend and wasn't too happy when I said yes, and let me off at the next Rasthof. Found a car taking me into NÃ¼rnberg there almost immediately though. 

But a lot of cars heading really f
Perfect spot to go to munich.
5 minute wait to Passau on a Friday-evening

It is a really frequent and amazing spot. It was easy to find a ride towards Austria [direction Regensburg and Passau]. I got here by walking/hitchhiking from FÃ¼rth through HÃ¼ttendorf and Kriegenbrunn small villages, and in the end I crossed this magic forest, and then just walked into the resting area. Good luck!
a lot trafic probably we dont have a luck, because in one time after 8 hours with a sign and asking people to got a lift, two driver stop one go to bremen second to hanover
[A1 West/Bremen | Friday] The first drivers I talked to gave me a ride to a small town South-West of Bremen for around 150 km. Awesome Spot because it's reachable by public transport with a bus.
A really good spot, and possible to walk to from Hamburg. Last time I were here (Jan 2023) was a Sunday morning with almost no traffic, but one of the first cars arriving brought me to Bremen.
Managed to get a lift south via A7 in about 20 Minutes for already two times. Also, Stillhorn ist very easy to reach. I like this spot a lot!
Bad for going south via A7, most of the cars were on the way to Bremen. waited for 1,5h and gave up, I went to the Harburger Rasthof Bege which I feel like is a better spot to get a ride south.
My only objective was getting past Frankfurt. Many cars indeed go to the Flughafen

I wanted to go north-west on the A3, so I should have stopped 1 gas station earlier. Than decided to take a ride to FF airport, but in hindsight I think I should have tried to get to Weiskirchen and cross there...
Great spot
not so much traffic on a saturday afternoon but still found a ride towards gieÃŸen in about 15mins.
Almost everyone here is going to Frankfurt. There is a restaurant with very nice stuff, free boiled water if you ask and even I could sleep inside the building ;)
Good spot just on the ramp leaving the station. Stood there to catch cars going Austria and somebody coming to the station noticed me and took me all the way to Slovenia.
Amazing place. I went here two times. The first time, I was with my girlfriend and we got a ride to Budapest in 30min. Second time I got a ride to Ljubjana in 20min.

Dont get dropped of here if u want to go further towards Munich!!!
If so, then dont wait at the petrol station. Go to the roundabout on the other side of the bridge.
If its late u can slepp here easily either in McD or in ur tent ;)
If you're going towards Austria it's easy going. Took me not even 15mins to find a ride till Linz.
m+f, early August, afternoon. Many cars, big rest station. We were too lazy to walk around and just sat down and waved our sign. After around 30 minutes we got a ride to Salzburg.
Got a ride to Dresden in 20 minutes however stopping for the cars is not easy with bike line on the side of the road

I guess it is a bit tricky here. In theory there is enough traffic and also quite a lot of space for even big cars to stop. However, they have to stop on the bike lane, which is not ideal. The gas station were completely dead on Saturday morning, so we hitchhiked by the traffic lights and eventually got ride behind Dresden.
This is probably a good spot, but I got here way to late so there was very few cars on the road

Me and my friend started to hitchhike around 9:30AM, we found someone already there and we were so lucky because we were in point to give up after 1 hour waiting then suddenly someone came and took us to Dresden
Nice spot! Two gazstations, 5 Minutes to get a ride to Dresden and Praha
BAD SPOT TO GO TO KÃ–LN. Was unlucky because nobody went there but very lucky to have a guy that dropped me to my final destination in Belgium. Thanks Dariusz! :) asked around

Early rainy Monday morning, people were cranky and not many. Should be better later in the day though. Got a ride to the next bigger station. Spent the night hanging between two trees in the woods here (beautiful and not transited).
Not busy in the night, the first driver we asked took us to autohof next to the Heidelberg (probably we were lucky)

less than 10 cars in 1 hour and none of them continued onto A45 - which was my way. You can change to the other direction at the end, when u walk down the right street just before the lane enters A5 again. There's a tunnel.
You won't find anyone going towards Marburg. Better get off the highway at Beltershain/GrÃ¼nberg and take the L 3127. I had to wait less than 5 min.

Took us 10 minutes to find a ride for Stuttgart BUT it was lucky (driver was coming back from a football game and stopped for a quick snack). The suggestion provided by another hitchhiker to ask for rides at the beginning of the petrol station was right. Again though, it was lucky. Karlsruhe doesn't seem like an easy place to hitchhike out of. Maybe it's better to wait for people to take you further like in Stuttgart, and staying on the A8 highway.

I had to wait 1 hour 30 min. 
The most people dont drive to the Autobahn
GREAT for getting onto the A8- asked only two guys, the second said yes. Took me to a gas station on the A8.
found a ride after 15 minutes. weekday around 14:00. direction stuttgart. ask the drivers, they are shy!
Seems to be an average to good spot for heading out of Karlsruhe: we went North and got lucky with a young couple heading to IKEA in Walldorf (passing by at the next rest area north of KA on the A5).
Good Place for Cologne, as everyone above said.
Got a ride to Monschau in about 20-30 minutes. Pretty easy.
monday morning 7 am. Wanted to go to mÃ¼nchen. One driver had said he went last week. 8:30 truckdriver could take me to NÃ¼rnberg. Awesome
In three minutes got a lift to Dresden

best place to get deep in to Germany
A4 A61 A5
let drop yourself at Kerpen so you get easier acces to A61 to the south
Waited for couple minutes thumbing at the exit ramp and soon got a ride going directly to Karlsruhe center.
Not bad not much else to say
Talked to the people there directly. Most people going towards Stuttgart with A6 but someone accepted to make a small dÃ©tour (10 minutes) to take us to Karlsruhe !
I tried to find ar ride towards Kaiserslautern, but there were only cars going south to Pforzheim, Stuttgart, Basel.

waited here for my hitchhike buddy to meet up (he started his journey in munster - i started mine in leipzig). Meanwhile, had a nice chat with a guy from lorsch. Many trucks stopping here, but manageable within an hour to get a lift southbound.
We initially wrote Innsbruck on the sign but changed it to GAP after 20 minutes, got a ride right after it

Update 2024 idk If they changed the Road but in my opinion its realy hard to Stop for cars without hindering the Traffic. Its better to place urself before the trafficlight so Cars can pull ober more easily
There is also the bus 134 from Solln, (Station "Neurieder StraÃŸe"#
good spot! the 3 of us got a ride to garmisch in about 40 min!

I was standing after second light where the road leads up to the A95. It's a good spot the cars can stop easily an not coming too fast. Many cars go also to the Starnberger See. I got a ride to Garmsich in about 30 min.

Hard to find people going to A9 or Czech republic. But we found a guy who took us all the way to Prague. So I guess it was worth the wait :)
But maybe consider taking a ride on to the A8 if you want to continue north/East

A lot of people going to Munich and Austria though

I messed it up with the previous ride lol so this one was the cool techno guy who didnâ€™t mind taking a bit of a different highway so I could get here. But the previous ride was with a woman who has hitchhiked herself and took me to the next gas station as it was way better there. :)

This is the best spot to pass munich to salzburg or up north. It is the last gas station before munich and a lot of people from the Bodensee Region are taking this way to Austria or the Balkan states. The route via Bregenz/Innsbruck is less popular. We needed 5min to get a lift to Salzburg and the guy who picked us up would have brought us even to vienna. The best way is to ask the people there.
gas station on either side, so you can go both ways: Munich AND Memmingen / Lindau! If you ask people directly you should be able to get a lift within 30 minutes.
gas station, not very many cars,most of them go towards munich

I was there twice on my way to France. ItÂ´s very easy to get a ride in the right direction, so great Spot. 
Hitchhiking further into France I always got stuck up in Mulhouse, so maybe itÂ´s worth trying over Basel or waiting fore someone who brings you to a gas station, not some roundabout near Mullhouse.
8 o'clock. Not so much trafic but or because of that a god spot:)
Don't really like the spot, people can't stop anywhere and it seems there's mostly local traffic. We changed for a spot directly along the Dreisam road.
Easily got a ride on the A5! Very good spot!
I was standing on the pedestrian walk next to the on-ramp with a sign. Didn't even wait for more then 5-10 min 'till the first car stopped and took me onto the A5

HÃ¼nxe. Sometimes you get a ride to Ohligers Heide in 30 minutes, sometimes you wait 3 hours before accepting a ride into the HH'ers hell that is Ruhrpot. Today was the latter. Don't be like me. It's (at least) Ohligers Heide or nothing.
One of my worst experience. So hard to go east. Many trucks but nobody took me

I met an absolute gentlemen offering to take me to north-west Italy across a two-day journey. While I was heading in a different direction, I did manage to head down to Karlsruhe with him. Great spot! Thanks J.!

Stop here if you want to cross the Ruhrgebiet, and try to get a direct ride across. On the A3 that means at least to KÃ¶ln. I got a ride there after some 20 minutes, but the guy eventually took me all the way to Wiesbaden after his scheduled work meeting close to KÃ¶ln had been cancelled.
Got a ride to center of DÃ¼sseldorf in about 20-30 min. Loads of traffic on a Friday evening (August '12).
Absolutely horrible gas station. We wanted to go to Munich but cars were either full or going in Austria. Maybe try to go to another one.

Please note, if you need a break from hh you can walk out the gas station and go to lake Tinninger for a swim or shower (40 min). Easy to camp around as well at night.
First car that stopped for me was going to Innsbruck, second car dropped me in Munich on it's way to Switzerland.

23 hours, trying to get to Innsbrook. Got some pretty unfriendly responses when approaching drivers. Eventually made sign for Munich, got a lift 6km to turning south, then waited 2 minutes and got a lift...
Good spot to go toward Munich, the first car stopped for us (boy,girl) was going to Stuttgart, but they were really nice they drop us in the centre of Munich
two guys hitchhiked here a car to Munich after one hour of waiting. The place is not so bad, many trucks going a longer distance.

This is a nice traffic light on an intersection - gives you plenty of time, probably around 1 minute or more. You can actually walk through the cars and people will often open their windows to ask where you're going. 
I wanted to go south to Stuttgart and I thought this would get me to the A5. I was wrong. Most people coming through here are going to Mannheim. It's a good spot if you're going in that direction, otherwise you should find another one.
To go south like me, try the Speyerer Strass
a lovely women dropped me off near Frankfurt. This spot is very great. Had a sign with me "FRANKFURT"
Really good spot to get attention from drivers waiting at the lights
Got a ride for two people to cologne after waiting for 5 minutes with â€frankfurtâ€ sign, monday around noon

I anticipated a fast pick-up ... however, it took over an hour to get a lift. To begin, there was a hitchhiking queue with a guy that didn't know hitchwiki!  That is awesome!  His sign that said 'A35 Bonn' was small, so when I made him a new sign, he got a lift in 10 minutes.

It took me another 15 minutes to get a lift from here.  Super easy since there's a lot of traffic.  I believe our wait time was just due to midday local traffic and a hitchhiking queue.  So, 4 stars.
"Stuttgart" on the sheet. boy+girl - big place, there is opportunity to wait at the end, but noone stopped for us. Better to ask at parking.
I don't know but this place did not worked for me twice. :/ But it's not looking like a bad place...
Got a ride to Dijon in 10minutes at 7am on sunday but i think it was just a single piece of luck.
Alright, you can pitch your tent in the nearby forest without problems should the need arise.
Petrol station with cars going mostly east-west direction. Quite easy to get a lift to Heilbronn or Mannheim.
Asked around with sign Hamburg. Lots of cars, and trucks too, calm. Most people, specially trucks, going towards Hannover, but still possible to go direction Hamburg.
We were sitting in front of the restaurant with a sign, until a guy approached us who took us to the A10.
People told me that they were either going to Poland or Hannover or inside the city. I finally found someone to give me a ride to the next gas station on motorway 10 around Berlin.

Perfect spot to get into Berlin, but other directions not so much. We were waiting for about three hours to catch a ride onto the A10 west, but eventually found someone all the way to Oberhausen. Still, not really recommended to go west.

well to Hanover
bad in Hamburg
East to go to Dresden
Good spot near to bus stop,
Got a great lift eith a hippie lady all the way to Berlin downtown. Good spot. Heads up, hitchhiking is not dead!!
Standard spot for going to Dresden, because most drivers pass here for the motorway.
I got a ride to Hoyerswerda, it took a while, I think most of the people are going to the highway

Two guys hitchhiking to MÃ¼nchen. The license plates mostly belong to locals, but be patient and youâ€™ll be picked up. The locals are friendly. They often wave and smile back even if they wonâ€™t pick you up. 

We stood by the on-ramp. Itâ€™s not a perfect place for drivers to pull in, but itâ€™s possible and cars behind can still manage to pass.

Onramp from Regensburg to autobahn. We were going in direction Munich, got picked up in less than 5 minutes. Cars coming slowly as they have to turn; there's no real place to pull over but they stop anyway, everyone in this area is very friendly and willing to help. We tried hitchhiking in other spots and many people stopped but nobody was going the right way; finally we got to this place and got a direct ride immediately.

Going to Munich worked. You can stand quite visible but the space for cars to stop is not very big, just the sidewalk and some green. Many cars did have local number plates (on a Monday around 15.00).
Actually not good for stopping at all. But people are nice anyway, so it works...
with a sign to get to Munich was very easy to get a lift
Ride to berlin fast, awesome spot, stand where the parking lot ends and not right before the highway start so the cars go slower.

Direction Czechia. Cursed place. Waited for 14 hours here after we got to a much worse place - the airport.

We decided to get dropped of here in the evening from a ride coming from Hamburg. We made a risky bet to try to find a ride to Czechia, or at least towards Dresden. We asked almost every incoming car for Dresden or Cottbus without luck. We found a Slovak van driving over the whole night but only with 1 seat, but we were 2.

The problem with this place is that there are so many directi

Many Cars. most of them going to Berlin, Some going to wards Frankfurt(Oder), Dreseden or South towards Leipzig. Took me about 30 min to find someone going to Leipzig but it might take some more patience.
All cars are going to Berlin, if you have luck like me you can get lifts further. (I got it to Leipzig)

Two or three drivers stopped for us here offering rides to Berlin while our destination was Poland. It took around 1 hour and we were approached by a driver who offered a ride straight to SÅ‚ubice, the border.
Spot is good. Many people asked me and offered different places. Unfortunately I had to go to KÃ¶ln, but otherwise I wouldn't wait for long time
Friday, got a ride to Bottrop (wanted to go to Essen). Cars to all Ruhr area and south (Frankfurt etc)
Got a ride luckily to KÃ¶ln in 10 min. Loads of cars driving to/from Poland and Belgium, some to UK. A perfect spot to go to East-west!

Got dropped off here at 01:30 from Michendorf near Berlin and stuck overnight during a thunderstorm. About half of all cars are headed towards the UK from Poland (at least in the summer) but most were full. In the end I gave up and walked to Rhynern (5 min), took the bus to Hamm and train from there to head westwards.
I had quite some problems finding somebody to Cologne. Dortmund and others along A2 should'nt be a problem.
Good to get out of Dortmund but not far

Good for loca rides to Bochum, Essen, Gelsenkirchen...
Senseless for further destinations. Therefore you better walk to the Sozialakademie which is 1 km to the east.
Good place if you want to go Essen or to the West. I wanted 20min. This exactly place is very secure.
Fast ride. Nuff place to stop.
Good spot to hit the road to the west!!!

tried with a sign "holland" and "A30" the latter worked and got a ride till the first service station.
lot of traffic, people are not so willing to stop after dark. i stood further down just before the petrol station
Took 3 hours to get a ride.
Everytime I start at this place to go in the south and it work well everytime. Use a sign with A1 --> MÃ¼nster
Waited 5 min, before i got a lift towards the dutch border.
Quite good spot :) But we 2 were waiting here for about 1 - 1,5 hour. Not the best place for cars to stop I gues,s but still I guess it is quite good place.
There is a decent amount of people stopping for gas/food. It's a tad easier to find someone towards Frankfurt, but continuing on the A7 is also fine. Found a ride to WÃ¼rzburg within 1h
I asked people around the gas station and got a ride to Wurzburg pretty easily!
good to north and south, to the east i needed 15 minutes, you can change your direction very easily

very good spot to go south - lots of cars, surprisingly many scandinavian tourists (july 2013). Not so good to go east, although the intersection with the a4 is close almost noone is going there. waited for about 2hrs before a local took me to kirchheimer dreieck (from there it was really easy)
traffic to frankfurt or wÃ¼rzburg. good spot

Got a ride to Ã…rhus almost immediately. It is the first gas station north of Hamburg, so a good spot for going north, allthough it takes a long time to reach this place from the city center. Look for Danish cars.

Not that easy to get there, you need to take train and bus (~1h from Hamburg center) 
You have lots of chance to find cars going to Scandinavia, look at the number plate.

Very good spot to hitchhike to Scandinavia. Just take a look cars, which has Danish, Norwegian or Swedish registration plate and try ur luck. Heaps of cars stop this spot for rest and fill a tank. Got a ride after 1 hour waiting.

But it is very hard to reach this spot. First u have to take S21 from Hamburg citycenter to  Eidelstedt (to direction of ElbgaustraÃŸe),then take a train A1 to Quickborn sud (to direction of Kaltenkirchen) and finally walk 3-4 km in forest.
This is good place to go to Kiel or to Flensburg.
Here we got a ride to Dresden in 20min

A good spot in direction to Dresden. We stayed there only 5-10 minutes and got a ride directly to Dresden. A lot of cars are passing by, even on holidays. Just don't forget to stay before the gas station as it's better for drivers to stop there.
Vor der einfahrt zur Jet mit schild hinstellen oder an der Tanke fragen.

well maybe the grunewald place is not under renovation but the road is or smthn. anyway sum hussle n bussle going on there, so for now this one is probably one of those better alternatives (summer 2025)
Hitchhiked to A9 (direction south) from here, because the RaststÃ¤tte Grunewald was under renovation. Stood at the gas station exit for 20-30 minutes, got a ride to a RaststÃ¤tte by A9.
Got a lift fast. 2 people. But just to another part of Berlin.
For going to leipzig very good. Me i get i ride close to nuremberg
Good alternative to raststÃ¤tte GrÃ¼newald, where the entry to the highway was closed. Found a ride immediately by asking at the gas station.

DONT go too late we are 2 guys we started at 1700 with a hamburg sign it was mostly family cars but eventually we got picked up, it was also quite a long walk to the gas station, we took a train to heligensee and walked 6 kilometers. But if you are trying to get to hamburg or north try at 1200

Seen some comments about this place being hard to reach and the fence being a problem so thought I should update the situation: I got there by train/bus and first walked by the road, then stuck to the fence (not autobahn side) at this moment I remembered the comments about a fence being a problem, but when closer to the petrol station, there was a gate you can go through, so no fence climbing needed :)
A truck driver I asked just after my arrival took me to Hamburg.
Most of the cars here are going towards Berlin. There's also great deal of locals. We wanted to get out of the city towards Rostock, and after 2,5h guy driving to Hamburg took us about 90km away.
This Petrol Station is great for hitch-hiking from Berlin to Hamburg. There are many cars going to HH. I hitch-hike there on May 2012.

Got picked up by a lovely lady going to Innsbruck, got all the way to Munich, very nice
Stayed at the exit at 7:30 AM

On a monday morning i found a ride to Nuremberg (rest area Feucht).
Its the best Spot Point to get to Nuremberg or Munich (or with little luck further).
had a lift to Hof, i waite 15min, this rest area is perfect

we were 2 people, found an italian lift to Rosenheim (100km southeast of munich) within 15min. Easy to get to NÃ¼rnberg or Munich. watch out for itialan / austrian / slowenian / croatian license plates for going far south, even to Italy or Croatia
this stoip is great if you want to go to Regensburg and further south. However I wanted to get to nuremburg. I waited 3.5 hours. Though this was in febuary, so it should be better in the summer.
Nice spot, enough traffic but probably not for longer rides.
Lot's of cars going to Frankfurt or the Netherlands. Just a few cars to Kaiserslautern or SaarbrÃ¼cken.
NIGHTMARE!!! Towards Netherlands, as of april 2014, there are construction cones before the entrance, nobody stops here. We have seen less than 10 cars an hour.

Good spot in the north direction - there are driving trough people going from south (Stuttgart, Switzerland, ...) and east (Heilbronn, NÃ¼rnberg, Czech republic, ...) to the north (KÃ¶ln, Aachen, Netherlands).

lot of traffic, but not to many drivers stop. maybe better in the late afternoon. there is an interchange after several kilometers, so you have the oportunities to go east, west, or north. many drivers are heading to france!
Good spot to hitchhike South. We asked the people at the gas station. The first couple took us to the service station behind Basel
For us it was quiet hard to find a ride to Bern (A2). All people went to ZÃ¼rich/Luzern..
First guy I asked took me to Bern, Switzerland.
In mid-May on a Wednesday late afternoon, Insa and Jan asked around at the service station. Got a ride fairly quickly, into Switzerland, near Olten (where the highway splits).
Big service station with a restaurant. Number of cars depends on time of day of course, but itâ€™s always easiest to wait at the gas station and ask.
not a whole lot of traffic tuesday evening and not much place to stop in either. still good for osnabrÃ¼ck/netherlands direction
Good for getting in direction of Netherlands.
Plenty of traffic at the fuel station, recommended. Most dutch people go for the A30 but you can find lifts towards Cologne and Belgium as well.
On weekends also ask Polish drivers  who are most likely returning to the Netherlands!
Tankstation Auetal, Good to get lifts to Bielefeld, Hamm, Dortmund.Also the last tankstation if you want to go on the A30 to OsnabrÃ¼ck or the Netherlands.Watch out for yellow numberplates!
Asking cars at the gas station, it took us 90min to find a ride to Karlsruhe.

Not a bad spot
Enough room for cars to stop and there's a gas station

Aral petrol station. Got a direct ride to Karlsruhe within 10min,
but not many cars.
it is a good place for hitchhiking, you should go to the petrol station directly  i never waited more than 20 minutes
Last Aral gas station out of Kehl.
We got a rider after ~30min of waiting. Not that many cars at a time but people were very friendly
The ramp is curved, not great visibility and not much space to stop. We got a ride to Leer in around 40 minutes
Good spot, there is a parking place nearby to approach people directly. We got a ride to the Netherlands in about 15 minutes.
For going to Nederland or Emden, Leer it is good place, cars are not so fast and there is place to stop.
ok spot, direction Frankfurt, got a ride with a van
Not a bad place to get to Franfurt. Plenty of traffic coming that way. (1 M, 1 F)
Resting Area with gas station "Rohrbrunn". Quite some traffic. Good possibilities to find a ride to Frankfurt. Also some drivers going west, maybe north as well.
Classic big highway station, perfect to go west to Stuttgart. Got a ride there in 20"
Took me way too long to get out of there. There wasnt too much traffic on a Monday afternoon
small petrol station to get west on the A8.
Traffic going in all directions out of Lindau. Lots of Austrian and Swiss cars. Cars can easily pull into the gas station.

Stood on the opposite side of petrol station entry as the point shows. Lots of cars going both north and south, so you get a lot of smiles, shrugs, and pointing in opposite direction, but shade and close to petrol station so hitchability is good. Got a ride in the wrong direction (people walked up to us from behind, not having read the sign) after about 15 minutes, and then one in the right direction 15 minutes later. This was mid july, during high tourist season, so waiting times are probably l

Gas station, waited 1 hour, asking people direction Munich. Many people told me they were going south, but after 1 hour I got ride direct to Munich. If you want to hitch-hike, thereÂ´s only a little bad place to stand, itÂ´s better to ask cars on gas station I think.
Great place for traveling direction to Munich. Got a ride in 15 minutes.
Good spot for going to Villach. We wanted to go to Vienna so it's not that perfect.

Took the train to Berg, it's a 10 minute wal from the station and relatively easy to enter the gas station area. There i asked around and got a ride to vienna in a unbelievable 1 minute waiting time from the first person i asked. Good spot for people with deutschland Ticket i think (cause it's close to the trains which go every hour)
Two of us got picked up after about an hour and were taken to Salzburg.

petrol station right next to exit, very convenient to be dropped off. was highly frequented because it was friday afternoon, and the begin of holidays in some german bundeslÃ¤ndern. stood at the end of the parking lot, with a sign "salzburg(A)" found a ride to Linz(A) directly which was even better

Was standing with a sign "Remscheid" for 1 minute before the traffic light where people turn left to get on Autobahn. A kind lady picked up took me to the resting station (the one before Remscheid). The best spot in Cologne to hitchhike towards Hanover/Berlin so far, cuz you target exactly the traffic which will take you to the big resting station which is very good for hitchhiking.

Really NOOO space for cars to stop and it is just a motorway access in the middle of nowhere, but traffic is okay (wednesday morning). Got a ride in less than 5 min as far as Braunschweig (on my way to Berlin). Maybe i was just lucky :).
It's a good place despite there's not much space to stop a a car. Anyway, we got a ride in about 15 min. I should emphasize that it was Sunday night, around 12 am and I was with a girl.
not a good place for cars to stop, but people will do!
lots of traffic on a sunday, stood at the end with no sign. germany rules!
Weekday late afternoon. Really low traffic heading towards Munich, better to ask people directly. I got lucky waiting at the end of the reststop with a ride to Innsbruck.
I usually wait 0-15 minutes to find a ride to Munich
Always a good spot to get a ride to munich.
Easy to get to Seesen
possibilty to change the side of the motorway
no problem to get a lift to the south in direction kassel

I found a man who can drive me all the way too Italy! Beautifull soul who picked up a motorcycle there! Before I found him I talked to 15 people. Was a beatifull spot also to sleep near by in a tent I think you could find a lil place somewhere!
If you are heading east, you can get both rides from people going via the A4 and via the A7/A38
The last petrol station before Kassel, so a good spot if you are heading east. I got dropped here, asked the first car I saw (a yellow Porsche). He drove me to a petrol station 100 km before Dresden.
Fuel station BÃ¼hleck towards east: quite some traffic, good place to get the next lift. Also easy to walk on from the town as there is a road and no fences.
Good spot, easy for drivers to pull over safely. Recommend for going east
Waited on a cold Monday at 9.30. Wanted to get to east (sign with A2 -> Hannover). After 30min ride to rest station Rhynern on A2
*WÃ¤chtlerstraÃŸe is for going west...

very easy to reach from bus/tram stop Wasserturm or about 15 minutes walk from Essen central station. There are usually free parking lots and space for the cars to stop in the street. Waited for about half an hour to go east on the A40. WÃ¤chtlerstraÃŸe on the other side of the big bridge should work fine for going east as well.
Which direction?
Waited 1 hour and 55 minutes to get to Chemnitz, 2/27/13 Wednesday at 17 clock

Von der Haltestelle "Connewitz Kreuz" entweder StraÃŸenbahnlinie 9 nehmen oder zu FuÃŸ zweihundert Meter sÃ¼dlich Richtung B2 laufen. Die sÃ¼dlichen Fahrer haben eine eigene Spur, die unter der BrÃ¼cke durchfÃ¼hrt. VOR der BrÃ¼cke kann man gut stehen, die StraÃŸe ist recht breit. Unter der BrÃ¼cke wird der Erfolg sich in Grenzen halten. Die B2 fÃ¼hrt zur A38, welche zur A9 fÃ¼hrt. Schreibt auf ein Schild A9 und geht sicher, dass ihr mindestens bis Osterfeld auf die A9 kommt.

June 2018 - 
Two people, got a ride all the way to Trier from here. During the two hours we waited that was however the only car with plates from Trier.
Found a ride for two people in May 2018 from here towards the north on the A3, within 30 minutes
2 people, weg got there from the center by foot to find a lift to KÃ¶ln, were taken quite quickly on the A61 and dropped at another service station before Bonn.

Very good! You can simply hitchhike to Cologne (north) or to Mainz/ Frankfurt (south). There is a lot of business traffic. From this patrol station you can take the following motorways: A 48, A 3 or sometimes to A61
Tuesday during Christmas holiday. Barely any car, more trucks. I went to the toilet and asked the first and only car that drove to Offenburg.
gas station
me and my friend (two guys) waited here around 20 mins, than a guy stopped and took us around 80 km north. It's a good spot, but there's not so much space to stop
Very good spot. All the cars coming from the gas station and from MÃ¼nchberg come by here. There is some space to stop for the cars in the entrance to the motorway...
I arrived here when it was getting dark and was giving up hope to arrive to OsnabrÃ¼ck. Luckily I found someone and he went out of his way to bring me to OsnabrÃ¼ck.
I was very lucky and got a direct ride to my destination Wuppertal (5 minutes).
I think its a good spot for going west. You can even camp a little bit outside of the service area (in the case it`s getting dark).

Surprisingly I waited only 3 min!

Cars go more or less fast but they have enoguh space to stop. Getting there its a bit rough.
Well, it is officially illegal, but when you get to this spot then it seems perfect with lots of place for cars to stop and everyone is going to the highway direction north

You can find the description \"how to get there\" at hitchbase.com.

Its the motorway entrance \"Schnellsen Nord\" northwards towards Kiel, Flensburg, Danmark. This place is illegal as you will have to cross the motorway-sign to have a good chance to get a lift.
Good amount of traffic goes by here. We asked around at the gas station and stood by the split with a sign where all the cars come through. Got a ride all the way to Arnhem with a dutchie.
Most the cars are going to the Ruhrgebiet. I got a ride to Bremen with a friend after a while.
Camped at Ammersee and got a lucky ride all the way to Graz, usually not too much traffic though

2 of us came here in the morning after camping at Worthsee lake. Coming from the side road and jumping across the fence was tricky, the best spot was at the main gate.

The spot is just a toilet and Parking so not much traffic, but we managed to get a ride all the way to Switzerland after 30 min of asking around.
Good for direction Munich
People can pull in at the gas station.
Walked here from the earlier onramp because it was closed. Had sign "A31" while walking.
Most traffic towards Steinfurt/MÃƒÂ¼nster goes up the B54 here, but not much space to stop cars,many trucks, best option is to hitch on the traffic island
Spot is perfect, but unfortunately had not much luck hitching with a "Jena" and "Gera" sign. Eventually a guy stopped and took me to Stollberg which was at least somewhat in the direction.

Technically my favorite spot for leaving town, however I once had no luck at all getting a ride towards Gera A4. The spot is awesome for Stollberg, ok for Leipzig and Hof (A72) but when I was there nobody was going west on the A4. 

I eventually left and found someone to drop me at the Rest stop a few km further towards Dresden. It was the same problem there, but eventually I found someone.

Really good spot for A4 traffic, not so great for A72. There is a lot of space to pull over, but most traffic isn't going very far.

And as much as I love my Heimat.. (I don't) :D People can be quite dickish towards foreigners here...
Stood next to the highway sign. There is a little space for cars to stop. Got a ride to Gera in about 20 minutes
Abgefahrene Landebucht fÃ¼r paradiesische Autoarten
There is a space small road for car to pull over, traffic is a lot, a nice germany family picked me up!!:)
Cars are coming of two directions. good amount of trafic. Enough space to pull over, but not too much.
safe enough to stand here and lots of cars from the roundabout. lots of commuter traffic early in the morning.
in direction Mainz it's excelent in direction Cologne it's bad
Easy pick up, can at least go to the highway
Bus stop on B213 towards Lingen. Just behind the traffic lights. No need to walk further out of town, this spot is good. Waiting might take a while though, people don't seem to eager to pick you up.

There's a bus stop at the verge where people easily can stop. Years ago when I live in Rotenburg I always used this spot for local hitch-hiking. But also to get to a highway in direction to Hamburg e.g. it's a good spot, easy to get away.
Unsuccessful. After Â±1-2 hours, we decided to go to Berliner Allee. Much better.

Pretty decent spot for me. I was staying in a really random spot, so got dropped here by a friend on his way to Erfurt, I was trying to get to Bielefeld. I waited near the exit, lots of space for cars to see and easy for cars to pull over and for other cars to get around them, and some sturdy oak trees to shelter from the weather. I got an extremely nice ride.

If you are coming from Suhl to enter Gotha, maybe you try to skip that place. Petrol is to expensive so not many cars will stop to fill up. Keep asking the cars at Burger King. Alternative is go of at Schwabhausen Busstop and try to get a ride directly in to Gotha.

Frequently used service station, restaurant and Burger King. To get a ride east bound seems to be easier. Be aware no public transport for this spot. To hitch out of Gotha to this place is okay , too.

Good spot to hitchhike into the city after arriving from A9.
I always walk the standing cars in front of the traffic light. Looking in their eyes and moving my thumb arm, it always does not take long until someone takes my with them :)

good for munich, berlin, erfurt
take the bus 131 oder 131 and leave at the stop hollÃƒÂ¤ndische mÃƒÂ¼hle before the nova eventis center, good traffic

Seemed relatively quiet just before lunch time. Lots of people not driving as far as on other stations on the A8. We still managed to get a lift quickly further along the A8 towards Munich. We were holding a sign that said Munchen and asking around the Maccies car park

Quite busy station with resting area and McDonald's. Works well for both directions on the motorway but yes, maybe better for East, as mentioned in the descripiton. Although we managed to get a lift to Stuttgart in 5 mins on Saturday evening after sunset. I suggest to wait not exactly at the gas station exit but 20 m after that, under a big street lamp (so you are visible at night as well) because by doing so more cars will be within your reach. (On the map: Shell -> Robert-Bosch-Strasse, ~20 m
Would be good for heading towards Munich. However I was going to stuttgart, So I walked about 1km and crossed the autobahn (on a bridge) where I had more success.
Good spot for far traffic (in direction A1 north). Although we were not able to find a direct hitchhike in direction of Bremen, we went to Nienburg
Waited for about 10/15 minutes before a car stopped that brought me to Bremen.
Nice spot for going north towards Bremen, Hamburg. Enough space at hard shoulder for cars to stop, with traffic lights in front of you.
Ich kann nicht viel direkt zu dem Ort sagen, da ich nach 3 min und 5 angesprochenen Leuten mitgenommen wurde. Das spricht aber glaube ich fÃ¼r sich :)
instead the bus you can start from jena-ost at the bus and tram station jenzigweg
Good petrol station to get onto the A9. take bus 431 from Jena and get of at "Gewerbegbiet Petersberg" to get here.
You can HH to here easily from CGN Airport and have option to switch directions to go south using the bridge over the Autobahn just to the south.
I waited 20 minutes here to go to Dusseldorf, but the guy took me to another place.. can't judge based on one time !

Despite waiting for more than an hour I'd still consider this a great spot given that I was there at 11 pm on a Monday. Despite there being mostly local traffic at the time, I did find someone going all the way to the Rhein Ruhr area very close to my destination eventually. I was also allowed to use the (very clean) restroom for free and staff was very friendly.
Have been droped here by a friend and had a right north to the nearest gasstation on the 3 in about 10 15 minutes.
Highway service station "Frankfurt a. M." on the A66 towards Mainz and Wiesbaden.
Asking around is the way since there are not so many cars passing by here. Managed to get a ride directly to Amsterdam after 10 minutes of asking ppl stopping at gas station

Petrolstation Grundbergsee.

Easy to reach from Hamburg as it is before Bremen. 

You should ask the people while fueling up or  before they go to the restrooms. 
Restrooms are free :)
This spot worked for us. but stopping there is a little dangerous. Then some lady stopped and took us to the service station on the highway.
Took me more time to write a sign then i actually waited :D
not the best spot to stop, but worked pretty good
not a lot of traffic but the spot is nice
Burg a. F. direction Puttgarden. A bit of a hassle to get there, crossing the busy road, but fairly good spot.

Hh spot. Picked up in 30 min with sign a5. Tried to get to frankfurt, bus since traffic is local, I got to a good gas station further on the a5.

Sign for long distance destination wonâ€™t be good!
We have waited 40 minutes with a panel indicating Munich (to get a ride to Stuttgart).
There is a large area where that forms a bus stop, easy for cars to see you and pullover.
Good to get out of the city to the highway in the south.
Es ist ein
If you have no luck, try the nearby petrol station (Alsfeld). It has a Autogas, so many cars from the Autobahn stop specifically at this Petrol station and then continue further on the A5. ~Lukas
on-ramp 2 Alsfeld Ost on the A5. Good for rides in direction Kassel

Two cars stopped, but only one went in my direction. Got me to S Westend.

Easily seen by incoming cars, they stop at traffic light. I would advise to stop 10m before Bus Stop.
in the city that connects with the ring highway and could take you anywhere west of Berlin. The cars have to stop for the lights.
Probably the best spot to leave Hamburg. I've caught a ride from this spot twice now but it's been rather slow both times. It's easier for the cars to stop here than at the Horner Kreisel.

Much better than the Horner Kreisel itself. Here the cars still have a way to go before they decide on which lane they should position themselves to go in the right direction. Would use it again definitely.

Bus stop "Caspar-Voght-StraÃŸe". Same cars as at the bus stop "BAB Auffahrt Horn" a bit further down the road (just in front of the "Horner Kreisel"). Only difference is that it is a bit closer to S-Bahn station "Hasselbrook" and that cars potentially drive a bit slower here because there is a red light.

good spot, easy reachable by foot from the city centre. we were standing there with the sign A9 and we were taken to A9 by Eisenberg in cca 30 minutes. there is a huge bike path and just a few bikers, so cars can stop there well

A lot of People in the direction NÃ¼rnberg or Erfurt and it is also possible to get a hitch on the A38 to Kassel. 

I used this spot a lot of times and usual waiting time is 30 minutes. 
Normally I use a sign with 'A9'.

Good place if you want to go south or west in the direction of NÃ¼rnberg/MÃ¼nchen OR Erfurt/ Frankfurt/ Dortmund. 

Cars can stop easily in Ferdinand-Rhode-StraÃŸe.
the spot is on the other side of the road and more west, i dont know how to move the green circle, sorry! see description english hitchwiki.

Good spot for hitching to the A3 direction Frankfurt. Space for cars to stop, and fast road with probably most cars going to the motorway. Only one experience so far, though.

Guter Platz, um auf die A3 Richtung Frankfurt zu trampen. Platz fÃ¼r Autos, anzuhalten und ich glaube, alle Autos fahren auf die Autobahn, oder zumindest bis dahin. Aber erst einmal ausprobiert.

The busstop does not existe anymore. WE stayed one hour and no one took us. The cars are going way too fast and even if there is a place for them to stop they dont usually have the Time to. 
WE dont recommand at all. It is easier to go to a rest area North of the city

people driving north will have to disturb the traffic to pick you, what may be a problem and explain why we had to wait more than one hour. 
Anyway on that spot you are hitchiking in the good direction and in a safe place close to a bus stop. 
furthermore we wait a long time but berfore being picked 2 cars stop and then realized they were not usefull to us. 
Not perfect but quite a good place anyway

I'm not exactly sure what I should put here... I got a ride in about 5 minutes with a sign that said, 'A5 Nord.'  There's a stoplight that backs up traffic for 1/3km, so you have a chance to look at nearly every driver in the eye to make sure they've seen you.  I got a lift very fast, but it could have been luck.
I waited too long in a miserable snow storm in february, and only got two offers in this time, second on to hamburg which i took. not many people going far

In my experience, the best spot for hitchhiking south (Hamburg) and also better than at Aral in Husumer StraÃŸe. Here is the direct highway access via the B200. The nearest bus stop is called â€œFriedenshÃ¼gelâ€. Drivers coming from the direction of McDonalds and wanting to get onto the highway often stop here for 2-3 minutes at a traffic light. There are also three supermarkets (Aldi, Rewe, Lidl) in the immediate vicinity of McDonalds. Aral is also on a highway ramp, but in my experience you are har
A very nice guy dropped me off near Heidelberg. I had a sign that said "HEIDELBERG". It was at morning
Not really a good spot, but mutch better than Aral gas station or standard hitching. Worked better here than traditional hitch, people stop on the crossroads.
We got a ride to Groningen after about 20 minutes. Good visibility and many cars and a bus stop next to it for stopping

Good spot if youâ€™re looking to go on the highway. Bus stop so lots of space for cars to stop. Found a car that brought me further from the border, at night thereâ€™s a lot of streetlights so you are still quite visible (but maybe not ur sign)
Like most places, no cars between 03:00-06:00. We slept in a tent and the first people we asked at 07:00 took us north of Hannover
was easy to speak to people and got a ride onto the next big station on A3 from where i could go on into NRW
Ask around, you will definitely find somebody going in your direction.
Took us a while to find a car in the direction of Karlsruhe. Modt of the cars are going to offenburg
Quite some space for cars to stop, many going to Bautzen or at least in that general direction.
Not to greatest traffic but maybe you will have more luck, there is the place to stop and shadow to hide
There is place for cars to stop. You can go to Regensburg from there.
great spot, very easy to get a lift to neumarkt if you have a sign and then regensburg. i was lucky though and got a lift straight to regensburg early in the morning
Quite high traffic. Some people stopped. None of them went to Berlin. We were 3 so that probably made it harder.
didnt feel like talking to people at the gas station so just stood at the side of the road. got taken immediately to berlin but the drive took forever because the guy preferred driving countryroads.

This is a quite big stop with a petrol station an a big parking lot. First I asked some people at the parking lot which was not really sucsessful. There were not too much cars and I decided to go to the petrol station. The peolpe drove in various directions and after a while of asking I saw a man filling his car with LPG. I've never seen this before and talked to him. Although he said he smokes in his car I got a lift to Herzsprung near Wittstock.
It was 15:30 on a weekday and there were very little cars. I asked everybody at the gas station for Hamburg and found a ride halfway there after 30min, but many cars also go to other directs
Not too bad for going South out of Frankfurt. Definetly ask around at the petrol pumps as drivers are going quite fast on the road and will struggle to stop.

Solid spot to reach the high way south or westwards. Quit some local traffic though. Waited 30 minutes until someone brought me q0 kilometers south to petrol station GrÃ¤fenhausen on the A5.

Spot is in walking distance from frankfurt main train station (30 min).
I think the spot is okay, next to busy road. Cheap rooms nearby. Think we just got unlucky on a monday
The guy from the gas station said, that we are bad for his buisness. We had to leave but found someone to achern
We were asking people at the station. After 25 minutes the lady from the station who was very friendly told us that her boss wanted us to go away

Great spot if you're hitchhiking from Cologne to the Netherlands. You can get here from Nievenheim train station and bus WE2. After that it's just a 15 minute walk to the station. 
If you look on Google satellite, you will spot a small trail after the bridge over the highway. It is traversable but I wouldn't recommend it as it leads through hunting grounds that are private property. Better to take the long way around. Either way, the service station is accessible on foot through a whole in the

I was there on a monday afternoon and was surprised by the little amount of traffic on this gas station. So there were some cars coming but not so many.
Indeed most people go to bremen or stay in the city. I was asking for Hannover and after a while i started asking also for lÃ¼neburg in a desperate attempt to get south. After an hour i got a lift to Uelzen.

Tuesday morning, the place was a bit more sleepy than usual rasthof, even though it serves both directions. I hitchhiked direction Nurnberg and many people said they go only to Heilbron and Stuttgart, but there is no petrol station on A6 on that way. If you go to Nurnberg, you need to get at least to Hohenlohe. Waited about 1 hour to get a car to Nurnberg. Overall not great, not terrible.

There is a lot of comments on this spot a few meters away about being a bad spot. Not sure if the petrol station is new here but that was a wonderfull spot with many cars going distances. After 10 minutes I got a ride to Leipzig which ended my damn misery down south with way too much waiting time in the January rain.

Hiked here from the raststÃ¤tte because there was a polish hitchhiking race with >8 people there. 

Climbing the mount from the North-west (like i did) isn't advisable but I'm not sure how else you would reach this place.
good spot can hitchhike cars from two ways
A lot of people can bring you here as there is a large amusement park nearby.

We (2 people) were heading towards France, direction Mulhouse => Lyon. Average traffic at Friday 7pm, but no ride possible for the rest of the evening. Got a ride the next day directly after breakfast directly to Burgundy, France, where we wanted to go. Best strategy here is probably asking people.

Good camping spot in the fields to the west (walk the small road between the restaurant and the gas station for 5 minutes).

Talking to people on the ferry was not successful.  I tried the last 25min, with a sign and going from group to group. That was not enough time to talk to everyone on the boat. 
If you don't have big luggage, you could just go onto the flixbus with the other passengers, if you feel adventurous.
Ferry tickets for passengers are always return tickets. Just ask the arriving people on the upper level if they don't need it anymore.

I initially stood by another traffic light farther north with a sign, and then I walked to this traffic light because it stays red for much longer, giving you time to walk around and actually get in a car without disturbing traffic.
I had a sign saying "Stuttgart" and eventually a woman waved at me from the passenger's seat. They took me straight to Stuttgart-Messe.

A sweet family picked me up!
Decent traffic(many locals), a lot of space for cars to stop.. Be prepared for a bit of a language barrier ;)
Decent amount of traffic, kinda worth the walk from the ferry even though I think there are okay spots also a bit closer to the harbour. Got a ride to a busier spot.
Many people to ask, a vibrant Raststelle. Seems good to trevel to the  north (Kassel and in the direction of Hannover)

I was lucky enough to hop in into the first car driving from that little road. All cars from there has to drive in the same direction, however, keep in mind that they might not take the highway later, and the road intersection later is not a good spot to hitch for the highway as there is no really space for cars to stop.
Nice spot, not too much traffic, but there's a McDonald's so some long distance.
Good place to talk to people and hitch a ride
Had a sign to Stuttgard and waived down cars taking the turn. Got picked up in about 20m to get dropped off at gas station towards Stuttgard. This can be a good spot
Very small rest area, but busy
There was a car on the way to work which took us further down the street.
It was august, a lot of older people chilling in their cars going from one village to another. Standing with sign is the only option, because the gas station near this point is closed.

Good spot to wait, very  easy for cars to pull over and stop just after the lights. Mostly seemed like local traffic though so went ignored by about 200 cars before someone pulled over. On my way to Prague and got a lift to Dresden from here
Place to get on the Highway from Mannheim in direction south
Quiet place but still got a ride in 7 minutes.
With sign "Zittau".
With sign "Zittau".
Got a ride to RaststÃ¤tte Muldental after 9 minutes.
With sign "A14".

Probs the best spot in Schandau, only place where cars can actually stop, but the traffic is not from the larger road, so probably not good for long distances, but we made it to pirna and maybe some ppl will be driving to dresden.

A guy and a girl on a Monday evening with an arrow sign (in the direction of Hamburg). There is place for cars to stop, and traffic is dense and slow. A lot of local traffic though, but enough people going far as well.

A guy and a girl on a Monday afternoon with a "HH" sign (for Hamburg). This spot must be quite good to go further south as there is a lot of traffic, not just local. Despite all this, the only car that stopped quickly only got us to the motorway entrance, further east...
Roughly a car every 10 minutes

It's not an ideal spot. There are traffic lights, so cars drive slowly, and there's a bus stop where they can stop, but if you're alone, only the cars in front will see you. If there are two of you, one person can go a little ahead so passing cars can see them first.
Kinda nice place to hitch when red light is on, but it is on for just short time. Might have good luck with nearby gas station asking around, but low traffic there.
Little rest station, not many cars stopping, I (solo female) stood at the entrance and got a car within 5 mins to the entrance of the highway.
Traffic going to Stuttgart + an easy space for them to stop.
Lots of traffic that is driving slow because of the lights, also a space for cars to stop.
I stood on top of the guard rail, a little before the parking spot as cars drive quite fast and it is right after a corner impacting visibility.
Solo female, at sunset/night. Not many cars, most of them going towards Denmark (should be quite easy that direction). I asked around with sign Kiel and ended up getting a lucky ride.
Solo female, under heavy rain. Sign to Hamburg, asking around in the gas station, the parking lot and the McDonald's door. Was lucky to get a car this fast given the circumstances.
Mostly LKW, but managed to find a ride to Kassel for a Swedish guy going to Italy and then I found a Polish bus going towards Wroclaw.
next to burger king where all streets going out of the city meet. had a sign saying A81. it was rainy weather but after a short while a truck stopped on the road an took us

A bit tricky to get there (be careful crossing the highway), but it's good for crossing the river. The only direction the cars go is the tunnel. Since it's an entrance to the highway cars are slowing down and have time to decide whether they want to pick you up.

Wasn't the best spot. But a woman asked usif she could take us with her.
Then we were invited to the 60's B-Day of Otto haha 

Take what you get ;)
In the shade of a tree. Waited 8 minutes for the first car to pass but it to me right away.
Caught a taxi while walking to the Autohof Westerlinde. The Autohof is not recommended.

Probably the best spot at the Kreisel. 
Often used by hitchhikers so locals are well aware that this is a spot to pick up people (at least our driver was).

you can get off at stralsund-grunhufe (i think thats what its called) train station, one stop from city center and stand on the bus stop. decent traffic, a few people stopped but mostly locals, got a ride going to rostock in about 20 minutes. mind you that was at 7 pm!

Thereâ€™s a bus stop on top of the hill, cars have time to see you. Only had a sign saying Bautzen, I was still picked up to go to LÃ¶bau. Not too much traffic but you should easily get a ride to LÃ¶bau, and you can take the bus if you really get stuck.

most likely i was really lucky as it doesn't look like the best spot, but i got a ride directly to my destination before i could even set up the sign. better spot than the tankstelle since you catch all the people going to the a20, not only those going out of the city. keep in mind not many people speak english in this part of germany!
There is a traffic lamp. A lot of people going to the centre of Nurnberg

Decent spot there is a small Restaurant and a electriccharging Station 
We were there in summer so quite some traffic. A lot of people went up north to Rostock but also some to Hamburg yeah
Its alright, it is possible for cars to stop,  but not much traffic, direction Karlsruhe
Not much place to stop, but its managable, perhaps a gas station 200m before this spot is better, but this works just fine
Nice spot, people are driving only short distances though

Got here by Bus 620 from Braunschweig city hall. Took me 50 minutes max. As there was not much traffic I was thumbing at the end of the service station. 10 minutes later I got a lucky lift all the way to Bruchsal West.
Okay spot if you are trying to get to the center.

Tried hitching from here 4 days ago. Was a nightmare. 3 hours without anyone even taking a second glance! Go to service station before

Good to talk to drivers who are refueling, but not many ppl are going very far south. Took a long time to find someone who only got me maybe 50km og A7, but maybe if you are lucky this is a good place.

Easily one of the worst locations I've ever waited at. Nobody seemed interested to pick you up. The station also doesn't get much traffic. A local car every few minutes on a Saturday afternoon.

One guy who passed by and smiled returned 15 min later and stopped and said that he never had any luck there and recommended to walk a few 100 meters further on to stand by the traffic light, where he eventually always had success.

We gave up as Flensburg was just so demotivating after coming for a grea
In direction of Hamburg you could also use a Rendsburg sign. Before Rendsburg is the first petrol station and there are a lot of cars going to Hamburg and further or even Berlin!
Good stop to anywhere... you can stand right next to the gas station, so you can ask drivers while hitching with your thumb. Best Spot in Flensburg!
good spot to go south! ask people at the gas station, but cars can stop at the roadside as well.
Wasn't successful with talking to people for 45 minutes, so I thumbed at the very end of the service station. Got super lucky with a lift to Dortmund.

It was an awful place for me. Waited around 4 hours for someone to give me a ride (tried both sides, talking to people and just catching by the exit). the place is very run down, there were a lot of people there the whole duration of my stay - however they weren't helpful. I don't know if its just my luck but i definitely wont try to catch from here again
Got a ride to Holland in 15 minutes on a monday morning.
Had difficulties getting to direction Koblenz from here on a tuesday morning, took me 1h45

Plenty of Driver going the direction of Frankfurt/Colonge. Don't expect to get into France this way. I ended up waiting many hours for a lift, and gave up getting into France. Got a ride to Belgium instead. :)
