I waited for a car in the petrol station two times, both with my girlfriend. First one in November of 2012 to go to Hamburg, we waited one hour. Second one in August of 2015, to go to LÃ¼beck (but with a sign for LÃ¼beck or Hamburg). It also took one hour
Not a good place to get out from Berlin. There's a little traffic and almost all of it is local.
not good for the highway
Cars go slow and see you from far. Not too many cars, though.
Very good spot with low traffic though. Good for Northwest, or to get the the (hard to reach on foot) gas station a bit downstream.
Sadly I got dropped here when I was told he would drop me to Frankfurt. I settled for a ride to the next gasstation as many cars where going east/west
i came here by car aswell from the south and got a ride with the third person i asked direction cologne. it was saturday afternoon and the petrol station quite busy

I don't agree with the first guy. I came to this place at 22:00 in the night and no cars were stoping here. I camped near the gas station with my tent and on the next day I got a ride with the very first guy that I asked. Got a ride after Frankfurt direction KÃ¶ln (Cologne)
Mind your words Koen ;)
I guess there's a reason this one wasn't added yes. It's shit. Mostly local traffic or only going to Frankfurt.
Not that much space to stop but the brave drivers do. Was here on a sunday afternoon so not a lot of traffic still got a ride pretty quick to a small belgian town behind the border.
Not to much traffic going on the highway direction liÃ©ge on a Thursday at 2 pm, but I got one after 30-40 min
we were 2 guys and found a ride to liege within 30 mins.
Good spot. I was standing with sign for LiÃ¨ge and got 2 offers within 10 minutes. I decided to wait and after 10 minutes I accepted one to Verviers because of its starts snowing.
The place seems okay but it took me a long time to get a ride towards Belgium on a rainy friday morning.

Officisl hitchhiking spot. We tried going to Denmark/Flensborg with a sign that said Flensburg/Rendsburg and did not find a ride  in one hour, so we changed route and went to Neumunster and changed side on the A7 at one of the exits
Official hitchhiking spot, we tried going to DK/Flensburg and it didnt work out in an hour. We changed route and went to Neumunster and changed side of the highway at one of the exits
Good spot to start towards the south.

Mh, wanted to go towards DK from there, on a Monday 2pm. the first car stopped after 1,5h. Very little non-local traffic. If you head to A7 I recommend to get a car to Rendsburg (i.e. don't hold a DK/FL sign) and get of after 13 km at the resting area [P]
I was skeptical at first because not that much traffic, but the hitchhiking sign seams to work. Only used this one two times (1 and 5 minutes)
There is no gas station. We try to hitchhike 50meters up the street.
Waiting before the gas station with a sign "Pott (GE / E)" (greater Gelsenkirchen/Essen area) made me wait not longer than 3 minutes. Hitchhiked mid-day on a Friday.

The only problem I found is that most of the people doesn't speak english. Also What I did was wait before the petrol station with a sign "D-Dorf" (Dusseldorf) so people could enter to the gas station to pick me up.
A lot of people, going North and South as well. Good point, but it will be better not just to stay, but talk with refilling people.
Intention was Dortmund but settled for a gas station direction Duesseldorf which ended up working well.  Found many people, if not most, were headed south from cologne.  Hitched Friday mid-day.
It was bad in Sunday, trucks have been banned.
This place absolutely sucks in Czech direction, avoid at all cost.
Great for Czechia or Poland or Munich or Bayreuth, but difficult for Nuremberg/Erlangen/Bamberg, we had to walk to the next village and go from there
Good spot when going to Czechia. Just look for Czech license plates and ask.
Probably i was lucky and got a lift within 5 minutes all the way to Brno.
Had to give up, nearly no traffic at all on saturday evening
A guy come to see us and takes us to liepzig on his road to berlin! But there were not much cars so we maybe were lucky here
i waite here 45min until i had a lift to Chemnitz,

Most of the traffic goes either north or south on the A9 took me 30 min to find somebody who could take me past the Hermsdorfer Kreuz. The people in the CafÃ© are really friendly though. I stayed there for the night and they didn't bother me when I was sleeping with my sleepingbag inside on the chairs. So good job.
Me and my gf wanted to go to Berlin (A9) but had to wait like 2hours 30mins on a sunday morning (7am- 10:30am). No gas station here.
Mostly locals, not many Cars heading to czechia, nice place but waited just for to long just to get to the border

Little traffic, 90% to Pirna
A guy finally took us to CZ rastplatz close to Usti
Great spot with tables and lots of shade, got a ride in 30 minutes to Prague, however not too many cars stop here

Its a good Spot to get a Ride to zcheck Republic
But since there arent a Lot of Cars IT can Take a while to find someone(asking people directly is Most efecctive).
We got lucky and catched a Ride to Bratislava.
Very good spot. Almost no traffic. But 90% cars who came there - going to Prague. Just wait and asked driver about lift.

As of December '25 its open!
Quite some traffic too
2025-07 it's CLOSED due to construction works

It had already gotten dark, but luckily an Indian couple who were heading north and not a big detour through Amberg took me there. But it was a funny moment when they thought I might be doing something illegal and asked whether I have a valid visa and documents to be in this country. ðŸ˜ƒ
One hour waiting for a car directly to Prague.

pentling is a big resting station with a lot of traffic coming through towards the north (maybe the traffic to the south is always stopping here) you can take a bus to "Hohengebraching" from the central station (should take you about 15min) and then you have to walk for 10min til you are there. very easy to find a ride

A lot of traffic on a Friday around 10am in August. Got a ride on the 57 to Dusseldorf within 10 min. There is a good place to stop for cars right at the entrance to the highway. We stood at the corner in the grass.
very little traffic here in direction of berlin
tried to go to the A1 direction north. After almost 2 hours just got a right to the next car park at A57

waited there about 30 minutes on a sunday afternoon with not much traffic in directio of Dortmund. Probably a lot better during the week. Not far from the S-Bahn station KÃ¶ln-Longerich (10 min walk). Cars a slow because of the traffic light and enough space on the side of the road for cars to stop.
Not a lot of traffic on a late wednesday afternoon. Asked the drivers getting gas, got a ride on the 10th ish try.
Easy to find a ride to Poland, there's a free toilet in the back of the parking lot also. Got catcalled by polish truck drivers but otherwise recommend the spot

Not bad, but not very good either. Most traffic goes through to Poland and the first service station on the Polish side isn't far away, but I found it to be extremely quiet on a late Monday afternoon, probably about one car every 4-5 minutes.
"Biegener Hellen" south. to Poland - ok. I'll give you 10 euro if you find somebody, from here to Frankfurt.

Traffic mostly local. Held up a sign to Poland and all drivers shrugged that they're not going there. But at 5PM on a wednesday it didn't take long until I got a car towards the border. Gas station employees gave me a piece of cardboard for the sign and were very nice. :)

Really quite a fair spot to get to east. A lot of traffic goes to the highway 12. The downside is that the cars have to drive all the way into the gas station to stop for you so definitely get a sign there.

I spen like 30-40 minutes there at around 11pm, and it was wet outside. Only 3-4 cars stopped at the gas station. I saw a Polish truck with curtains drawn, parked there. Then suddenly a driver appeared there. I talked to him in my poorly Polish and it worked, he was going to Wroclaw, and it was on my way to Cottbus! Such a luck!
Good place to hitchhike to Poland, a the entrance of a gas station

I wanted to go Nuremberg from this spot which is far south-east from here in Bavaria. 
But I didn t find anyone willing to take me in that direction for more than two hours. After which I found a non-native who agreed to bring me to Passau which is even farther.
Generally people were unreceptive to taking me with them.
we were lucky and at daytime a lot of people stopped there... there was traffic jam so they could leave the rest stop as quick as usually and we could get a ride after 5 minutes trying.

according to my experience there is quite little traffic on this motorway saturday evening. was very lucky to get a ride to Karlsruhe in 10 min, though there were ca. 10-12 cars resting at the same time, not a lot...
I got here around midnight on Saturday so I had to wait for a long time. A taekwondo team going to Nuremberg agreed to take me.

The gas station going south towards Frankfurt. It has a motel as well, so there are always a good amount of people passing by. We stood by the entry to the highway, waited about 20-30 minutes and got a direct ride to the airport.
Some space for cars to pull in but not alot. Many were not going far. We were 2 people

I got a ride very quickly, there isnt too much space for the cars to pull over unfortunately, and its also technically illegal for cars to stop here, but it works fine if its not too busy. All in all I really like this spot, the apple trees are a big bonus
okay, its a great spot, but cars can not stop easily

A personal favorite because there is an apple tree right next to it!  There's space for cars to pull over, but they can only stop if there's nobody directly behind them, so don't use this spot in very heavy traffic.
direction berlin. good to reach, good for drivers to stop but sometimes difficulties with the police.
Had no luck here to get a ride to Stuttgard even though it would be perfect for cars to see you and stop.
Very fast, good for way to South (Strassbourg)

Been here for two times to hitchhike in direction of freiburg. Both times i got taken at the traffic lights in less than five minutes but i guess i've been lucky :) Infront of the huge govermental building ( maybe bundesstaatsanwaltschaft?) there is a good place for cars to stop but the security guard will send you away. cheers
Good Tramping place in all direction. Enough place to stopp for cars.

May 2023.
On-ramp that works okay enough, was little traffic at 10 am on a Wednesday, which probably was a benefit. There is a breakdown lane where the cars can stop, and it's decent enough for being an onramp.  Got a car to KÃ¶nigsforst RaststÃ¤tte after fifteen minutes. 

Definitely better than having to climb the pointy fence at the gas station.
Good spot, started early in the morning, waited 25 minutes to get a ride to RaststÃ¤tte Siegburg. We put "A3 Rasthof" on our sign.

I followed the instruction on the main page for Cologne and caught the Tram U9 to KÃ¶nigsforst, then after looking at the map at the train station there walked about 1km to the onramp, found an ok place to hitch from and held up a sign for the Siegburg Bahnhof - only later did I realise my error, I should have written Siegburg RaststÃ¤tte, to get dropped off at the rest stop about 15km south along the A3. I was dropped off in the Middle of Siegburg and had to walk the 3-4km through the town to get

the first time I hitchhiked from here it took me about 1 1/2 houres to get a ride, but only because eventually I stepped onto the road to stop a car to take me to the next filling station along the A3. The two other times were much better, had to wait about half an houre each time.
on ramp of the A3 to frankfurt. cars can stop easily here. average waiting (male) time: 1hour or less. if you get a ride just to rasthof siegburg, take it.

quite big, many cars to talk to. but you need to walk back and forth a lot. somehow a lot of cars going to west Germany. We were a bit frustrated at some point. took us so much longer than expected to find someone to take us (2 male passing people) to berlin/Leipzig.

friday all day in july, towards berlin
i guess ive been very unlucky, cus in the morning there were a guy going to berlin and a couple going to sweden, and very quickly they got a ride
for me didnt work that well, i had to wait over 6h for a lift 50km north
many cars stopped, but they were going west mostly or elsewhere
Not a great place wheb going to Czechia. Better to go to another gas station on A6.
Wonderfuk spot, I just waited at the intersection after the mcdonalds (asked them for cardbkard and a marker and they gave them to me) and just had a sign to leipzig, worked like a charm
Got a ride from the first people we approached all the way to Emmen (NL). We were hitchhiking with 2 Dutch guys and asked Dutch people, which probably helped.

First day noone going south, only Frankfurt or Frankfurt airport. Next day we had a sign saying A5 SOUTH wich was very helpful and got picked up in 20-30 minutes, and drove close to Landau. Got dropped of at gas station near Edesheim. 20 minute walk there, and a store, so you can buy food etc.
Many directions, many people. But a lot of them driving to Frankfurt. I was maybe just lucky
I found a guy after an hour of waiting who took me to Stuttgart. However I think itâ€™s not that easy there because there are a lot of local drivers. But if you are patient it can work.
Large gas station. Felt a bit dead so I got a ride to a gas satation South of Frankfurt. He offerered to drive me to Karlsruhe, but I chose the gas station mentioned above.
Couldn't get to SaarbrÃ¼cken or even Kaiserslautern for 3 hours, then accepted an offer towards Mannheim. There's a fair amount of local traffic here according to the driver.
Don't come here for taking A9 north. I finally went to look for a better spot
A Decent amount of people going north and south on A9. Not so many people heading onto the A14. I found someone quickly for going towards Halle ~Lukas
You also might find some drivers going west to Halle (B6)

A lot of traffic goes south here, some are going west (A4) direction of Erfurt. Very few go north-west with direction Magdeburg. Anyway i found a direct lift to Magdeburg after 45 minutes of asking people at the gas station.
A good place to get from the highway to a city train to Leipzig. The train stop is about 500 m away and easily accessible on foot.
Had a Munich sign, but mostly tourists not going so far
We had a Munich sign but no one took us while getting out of the ferry. We waited for 2 ferries.

A lot of people from Konstanz and Switzerland are taking the ferry and the route via Friedrichshafen to go to Munich. My girlfriend an I were standing there in the morning with a sign "Munich". A guy on the  first ferry after ours took us from there to the gas station "Landsberg am Lech". So we waited about 15min.
This service station doesnÂ´t exist anymore. If you want to go South use the next one SalzgitterhÃ¼ttenblick Nord.
I arrived late at night, slept in the nearby wood and got a ride in the morning easily.

Sehr gut, um aus Braunschweig richtung sÃ¼den weg zukommen!
Ruhig kleinere lifts bis bis zur nÃ¤chsten RaststÃ¤tte (harz west) bei seesen nehmen, dort ist man direkt auf der A7

to go to the south on the a7. from braunschweig take the bus to rÃƒÂ¼ningen and exit at station raabestraÃƒÅ¸e. then cross the bridge and walk about 300m over the fields to the station. not many traffic at this station but almost better as if you would wait on the highway entry
Got a short ride to Unterhaching junction, happened after some stranger wished me luck. OK spot, using a thumb works best, since I think most cars are driving not far.
Good for direction Salzburg, Wienna
waited 15min at the traffic light for a direct lift to Vienna, had "Salzburg" on the sign.

I only waited 5 seconds for a lift dierctly to Vienna. There are wonderful traffic lights and with a nice board with your destination in your hand and a smile on your face its not difficult to get a good lift.
Not perfect place. Mich people to Dresden or North (Leipzig Berlin)
Many people go towards Dresden, not Leipzig or Berlin. Still easily doable to find a lift, you can speak to drivers. I eventually found a truck driver who took me.
Medium traffic on weekday morning. Most continue on A9 north.

Resting point.
En route north. Not extremely many cars or trucks, but enough. You can speak with the drivers. In my case all were friendly.
Most of them went to Dresden or further to Poland. But I found someone going to Berlin
Good spot, even if not super busy. I got lucky and found someone to take me in the direction of Kassel fairly quickly. It was around 7:30 pm on a Monday in mid July.

We were two people trying to get to Stuttgart on a saturday. Mostly locals driving. Not so many cars stopping, those that did were heading for Frankfurt. Decided to hitch a ride towards frankfurt to a gas station after couple of hours
Good point to go to the neighberhood. also to get to the a71, but you'll have to be lucky.
Good point to hitch away  and ti get on A71. Attention: there is only only one Gasstation on A71, and the parking places are rarely visited.
The stop bay is a perfect place to get picked up for the A5 north and south. I always get rides in about 5 minutes. But you're unlucky when the stop bay is full - mostly there is space though.
standing next to the traffic lights is no good option... go a few meters down rheinstrasse to make the drivers see you.
In front of the hotel Maritim is a stop bay for cabs etc. Cars can stop safely. The road leads to the A5 and A67 both North and South and most drivers use this way to get onto the autobahn.
Towards Amsterdam nobody took us
Towards Netherlands all the truck in the right lane and cars can't see you. Better go further up the road or wait at the station. (My case because of the rain)
Stood there with a "Hanover" sign. Good place because of the nearby traffic signal and gas station. Also, small shoulder for people to stop.
Last gas station before the highway. We were standing at the Werrepark bus stop. Lots of trucks but not really a place for them to stop.

Direction: Berlin

I waited there with a sign, the street leads to the motorway witch goes to berlin. The street has several entrances to stop as a driver. I am not sure how many people are intending to use the motorway thats why I rated the spot with 3 stars
The spot itself is good, but very shitty if you mean to go south. I had to wait 2 hours, many cars stopped but all of them were going further west. In the end I had to be content and go west.
There is a parking place behind petrol station where many truck drivers are resting. We came there in the evening and found some trucks going to Poland early next morning.
Going into Magdeburg. Drivers going past can drop you here. There is a tram line running and a gas station a few hundred meters down the street where you can try to get a lift to the center.

I guess it is tricky here. There was almost zero traffic! We stood in front of the gate with sign and everyone ignored us until a campervan came and took us. It were 2 girls who knew they can take extra people for free.

BAD plan to get there to cross. I almost did it with the truck on the side. But i dont think any car will stop in front of the ferry gate, there are focus on something else, and probably thinking about extra fee. If you want to cross here, the best Wat is probably to find a car more in the inerland. Like a gasstation in LÃ¼beck would be perfect, there you can target danish plate until you find one that cross on the ferry. 
Otherwise it's 20 euros to cross as a pedestrian

TIP: ask arriving passengers for the return-ticket, because ticket machine sells only two-ways tickets (have no idea why). If you'll not be successful you can by a ticket for children for redused price, nobody cares about it.

So, we were waiting here for an hour and a half without any result. We stood at the begging of the road to gates, i guess drivers at these moment only thought about what gate they have to choose, therefore they didn't stop. Maybe it's better to go futher right to the gates
weren't successful on a quiet Sunday afternoon and went on the ferry as foot passengers as well

At the beginning of the overhead signs, there is place to stop. We weren't successful on a quiet Sunday afternoon and went on the ferry as foot passengers (by asking arriving passengers for their leftover return ticket)
Found a car to the direction of Salzburg but there isn't much place for cars to stop

It's not a very good spot according to a space to stop for cars. There are traffic lights and this is a street straight to highway A9 going north. After 45 min a guy stopped here and took us to Nurnberg (but he was going to Frankfurt)
In direction of Prague, impossible for me. The only place from Lyon (France) to Varsow (Poland) I found nobody

Me and my friend took the metro station - Frankfurter Ring and walk a little through the Frankfurter Ring- till a bus stop and a signal. Is good because there are a lot of cars (but not very much trucks). It's a good way to go to cities like Frankfurt.- because the A9 road.
Go to Metro Stop Studentenstadt-500 mtrs. Outbound Good for hiking to NÃƒÂ¼rnberg
Very low traffic volumes, probably better to jump off at the bigger raststatte Aalbek half an hour before if you need to go past hamburg.

I agree with the latest review, it is entirely better to directly ask drivers in Germany (and elsewhere for that matter). Wasnâ€™t having a lot of luck but by looking at the license plates I found a direct car to Bremen! Very sometimes the license plates are good indicators here in Germany :) I mustâ€™ve taken around 20 minutes before finding that ride

Solo female, Sunday midday. At first was waiting at the end of the gas station with sign to Hannover, did not work. Forgot Germans like to be asked. I sat on the stairs to the shop while writing a new sign and a woman approached me immediately with ride to almost Hannover.
Worked good. Asked a guy if we could go with him to Hamburg, he accepted!
Got a ride all the way down to Nuremberg early in the morning!

On a Monday in mid July around 8 pm there were hardly any cars and no one was going in the direction of Kassel. After 45 minutes of waiting I ended up accepting a ride to Frankfurt since I had gone the route from there before and it seemed more reliable. Bonus points for the cute kitten at the gas station though.

my parents live close to this place and I always use it to go anywhere. if you want to go east you have to go to the lower gas station. unlike the previous commenters, I think this is a good place to go east.
I got a ride to Kassel (~15 minutes).
Great spot. rainy day helped. nice multivan stoped for Frankfurt. many people stoped to ask, but they were going half the way, and we wanted a direct ride. So yes, finally got it easy. :)
I wanted to go to Kassel, which was not easy. Finally I was taken to the next highway exit and did it without the highway. Guess southwest (to Frankfurt, etc.) is much easier.

The gas station is very bad with very few cars. There is no service station, so very few cars stop. But hitching directly on the motorway is possible because of speed limit and lots of place for cars to stop.

Very good spot to catch a ride in towards france. There is a broad and long shoulder for cars to pull over, and there is a lot of traffic moving into France. My shoulder started hurting by  holding up my arms for so long because so many cars were passing by.  

I got a ride to Metz in about 25-30 minutes.

Good spot reachable by foot, but the traffic is little. There is a German police station on the other side of the road, so a lot of lorry drivers won't take you with them (it's illegal for them). Waited a long time, but finally somebody took me to Reims in one go.

The gas station itself is very bad, very little traffic. You will loose your time there. But its possible to hitchhike behind the station directly on the road. Its an old border crossing, there is a lot of place to stop and speed is limited so cars go slow. I got a lift from there to Reims quite easily.
easy to get to metz.

We met 2 girls hitchhiking here already, that were standing with a Berlin sign and asking for over an hour. They were saying the people were not really polite and mostly ignorant.

To give them space, we moved to the shell station a bit south with a sign and stood next to the road in the dark. Luckily a car stopped rather quickly to Berlin.
We wanted to east (to Poland), but most people only go to Berlin, so in the end, we also went to Berlin.
Two guys, waited 20-30 min at SHELL gas station, after that choosed to go at this gas station. It's took 7 minutes to find car to Berlin. Depends from luck, but good place

Most of it is local traffic. Waited for one hour with sign "Berlin". Many people just helplessly smiled, wanted to help but couldn't.
2x more cars going in and out than in shell gas station closer to city.
Friday 15:30 January
There are quite a lot of drivers using this gas station but it still took me ~1.5 hours to get a ride to Berlin.

There is a little spot at the traffic light where you don't bother people on the cycling lane. Cars see you there and, if they want to stop, there is a secondary street right after where they can stop and you can quickly hop in. I realised a guy stopped only because a pedestrian shouted so be aware of your sorroudings. You can easily hitch by that turn.

For heading East (Neustadt, Donaueschingen)

Get to the south east of the city where the Leo-Wohleb-StraÃƒÅ¸e and SchwarzwaldstraÃƒÅ¸e meet each other (B31). Somewhere there is a strip of grass right in front of a side road. As this is a busy road leading out of the town waiting time is not very long.

Got here in the evening on a multiple day trip heading to vienna. A friendly local took us to a very good camping spot with a great view of the alps in the area. Not so good for going far distances.
Summer 2025
30 minute walk from either train station Raubling or Brannenburg
Rest place full of cars going north towards Munich and south towards Innsbruck. Stand at the exit of the rest stop, here the cars driving on the road also see you.
We had a sign with direction Freiburg!

This is the entrance for some companies with a relative good place for cars to stop, but it might be better to try to find another place. The cars are relatively fast, the place is not soo big to park but it took me 15 min to get out of there.
Had no luck at this bus station a weekday morning. mostly local traffic. Maybe better go to jena/erfurt or eichelborn nord first

Standing at the bus parking on the side of the road works fine for getting to the highway. I guess chances are higher here than at the gas station, because there are a lot of cars on the road, but just little on the gas station.
Right now the roundabout is closed due to construction. If youre heading to KÃ¶ln i reccomend taking the 52 bus from the city centre to the gas station on autobahn 4. Its like 10 minutes.
Got a ride within 5 minutes! It's an easy spot to get to from the centre of Aachen.
Roundabout \"Europaplatz\" with direct exit to the motorway. Enough space for cars to stop.
it's an okay spot if you want to get further into the city
Bit weird to get and stand there but a lot of cars. Enough place for cars to stop

Wanted to go South and made the mistake of taking a ride to the newly built A49. There are only small gas stations and I could not really find someone there. So if you want to go South. Take at least a ride to Hasselberg Ost or Reinhardshain Nord as there are no suitable service stations in the Kassel area.

I (27 years old, male) got a ride towards the south on the 5th of August at 2 am after 1 min! To reach the petrol station get a bus at the main train station towards Rosdorf, stop "Obere Strasse" and then 15 min walking.
Service area "GÃ¶ttingen West", direction south. Nearly everyone could take you to Kassel at least.
Indeed not really a place to stop for the car but you catch people a
not that bad to go towards Chemnitz, A4, stay on the lights
Waited for 90 minutes towards Aachen, moderate traffic, only half of them going westbound. There is a place for cars to stop.
on-ramp towards Aachen is currently closed :/
There is a short but sufficent extra lane here to pull out - made for hitchhiking! Great in direction West - Aachen
A lot of trafic, but people are hesitant to take. We approached a minivan after 1 hour and they cleaned the space for us inside

Rest place with restauration, but no gas station. The first place on the higway south from Munchen. A lot of Truck drivers there. Guud spod for going to austria. Waiting there for two hours (boy+girl)
In theory spot seems good, but I had no luck. Ended up getting picked up, by misunderstanding in wrong direction

A good spot for rides north direction Hamburg. Get with the tram to "Alter Flughafen" from there follow the road north. There are plenty of spots a long the street where cars could stop easily and even a petrol station where you could ask directly. I and my girlfriend stayed with a sign HH (Hamburg) just 5 minutes and got a ride to the petrol station "Allertal" at the A7. From there it is super easy to go to Hamburg.
30 min waiting for Osnabruck with a carton.
It was raining, a germany man heading to frankfurt picked me up, lucky!
Best place to stand when you wanna go to Kiel.

We were two guys, waiting for half an hour on a Saturday morning. It's just a traffic light, feels hard to score a ride. Decent amount of traffic, but most just flows through during the green light. Also all directions are still mixed here, including both north and south on the A5.

We ended up relocating to the Esso gas station in Speyerer StraÃŸe, which seems the better choice for going south down the A5.

We were 2 persons hitchhiking together. At 4:45 pm when there was a lot of traffic. Didn't have to wait long at all - a lot of were reacting to us (1 lady said sorry for not taking us because she lives in Heidelberg).

Was stupid and hoping for a ride all the way to Hamburg so turned down two rides offered to the other side of Bremen within the first 20 minutes. Ending up waiting an hour and a half just to end up on the other side of Bremen. The spot was busy, but it seemed to be mostly older people and packed cars of vacationing families. I didn't ask around only thumbed.
Just asked at the petrol station, took me 5 min. DIrection Bremen / Hannover. Awesome!
petrol station Hasbruch SÃ¼d on A28 towards Bremen. Good for rides direction Hamburg or Hannover.
Took very long, many people during lunch hour at Burger King. After that slow traffic and many local people

There is an Aral petrol station and a burger king. To catch both stay at the road in height of the burger king at the bus stop. Lots of cars stop before going on the a61 in both directions. Traffic gets more and more cause of the Airport Frankfurt-Hahn
OK spot. Very likely to catch traffic in direction of OsnabrÃ¼ck. Although there is also much local traffic

Ramp 'HÃƒÂ¶rstel' towards OsnabrÃƒÂ¼ck. Walk along the BahnhofstraÃƒÅ¸e, go left at the protestant church and follow the street until its end(1,5 km). At the end walk right and you'll see the highway.

We got a lift to Prague an hour after being dropped here on a Sunday. Talking to drivers or truckers is necessary, there was at least 11 when we passed through. Traffic driving by  is going too fast so unless they're already pulling over to the truck stop you wont have luck signing them to slow. Would avoid getting dropped here in future though, felt like we got lucky after an hour and could have been there all night.
Okay, i had luck with my 10 min waiting time, but i think this place could be empty if you are standing here not on the good day.
The last place where you can a highway stamp for the Czech highways. Even on Saturday, football evening there were a lot of cars, and the first car stopped for us and took us all the way to Prague.
The road in front of the departure gates is also a good spot to ask. Any car going north in the A59 Autobahn can take you to the next Rasthof where you can also cross to the other side to go south.
there is a petrol station and it is near a huge parking garage (if you arrived with the plane, people from your plane will notice you and pick you up)
Works fine for getting on the road quickly.
If you are lucky, one of the truck drivers will get you to Michendorf (where the chances are much higher) and maybe even further. You have to just go from car to car and ask for your possibilities.

The spot is ok but not perfect. maybe it is even better to stay in greifswald on the street but not sure about that. On the onramp itself 8direction Rostock) there is not really space so you need to stand few meters before. Drivers can see you well but cars are quite fast here.
for going to LÃƒÂ¼beck, Hamburg, Rostock cars can see you early, there is some space to stop and they can take you up to the petrol station near Rostock.
Was aight on a Sunday afternoon. Got a ride to Leipzig
I chose that spot to hitchhike to Leipzig, waiting time: 4 minutes on a late friday afternoon. Good spot, but the sunlight will blind you at this time of the day.
Good place. If you can stand the sun, go direct to the crossing, so the people can see you. The best thing about this Hitch-spot: there is a crocodile holding his thumb up ;)
not very frequented, lots of local traffic, but somewhat possible to hitch cars going from traffic lights. In direction west you can ask people to give you a lift to station in Wattenheim.
Not so frequented gas station (not on sundays at least .)) but one of the best spots from Mannheim in direction to Saarbrucken - Paris.
Great Spot for a hitchhike to Dresden. Waited just 5 Minutes for a perfekt Ride. I had a sign with me.
No traffic lights, but you are well visible and there's enough space to stop. Direction Dresden. I waited for 10 min. without sign.
Ha a good lift out of the City to the better hitchhiking spot. With a sign towards "Hannover/Bremen" it went okay. No opportunity to talk to the drivers so keep up the smile.

We used this spot to hitchhike south towards Hannover. There is a place to stop just behind the junction and you can make yourself visible to drivers coming from all directions. Furthermore this spot is in walking distance from the public bike station next to the Hammerbrook S-bahn stop.
Instantly, the first car I asked took me. Decent amount of people stopping here, you can talk to people easily and get a ride.
Monday evening, got a ride to Munich within 5 minutes. Place is small.
motorway station with a small toilet house. don't do that
Really tough spot. Difficult to stop on the on-ramp.
the gas station is a perfect place. You wait 5-15minutes.
gas station/Tankstelle Aral und McD
Did not work towards Berlin.

To get out of Dresden in direction to Berlin, you should definitely try this spot. You need to take a train from Dresden-Neustadt to Dresden-Trachau and to walk for 15 minutes (streets An der Durren Heide and Heulander Strase). There is a traffic light and cars come in waves. They can easily see you and it's easy to make eye contact with drivers. We got  a ride after 10 minutes.
very hard to get to Berlin, many cars going to Poland and Czeck Republic. Also, very little traffic, at least friday evening when I went there.
Good spot to go from Dresden to Poland. I used it twice, in both cases needed to wait approximately 1h, but got ride at least to the border.
Not a good place if you want to go to Lubeck, or to Denmark. Waited here loooong time, then friendly truckdriver gave me a ride to Danish border in Padborg (thanks Jerwin, you're the best!)
To LÃ¼beck
Good point to find someone who is going to Berlin
Huge place, a lot of traffic here. Sadly many cars are families so are full. Gas open 24/7 so we could chill a bit.
There is a construcition site (Baustelle) here on October 2015, barely any Traffic here.

Rastplatz Hohenlohe Nord

Hitchhiking on Sunday, August 28th was very hard (had to stay overnight) cause cars were full with traveling families and trucks are not allowed to operate on Sundays (except for freezers). However, this place is in the nice area and with plenty of space for camping at the back of the station. I recommend to talk with truck drivers - a lot of them are going to France and willing to take travelers.
didnt get pick up although loads of cars
Good spot on the 71 towards Salzwedel.
First we had direction to NÃ¼rnberg bit nobody stopped. We changed to Waldenburg and we got a ride.

A good spot if you want hitch on the A6. The cars are slow here.
To stand direct on the traffic light is not a good idea because the cars have no possibility to stop there.

Gave it a try for 30min on a Thursday morning from 8 to 8:30 with a sign saying " A14 R. Dresd"  First I tried behind the crossing. I don't think it's such a good spot. Two columns come from the traffic light, only the ones on the right can really stop on the right side, left column is "stuck": there are cars to the right and behind. Not a relaxing position to pull over. I'd say about 40% non-local car plates. Visibility is there, but only for the first two rows of the cars waiting. Then I tried

Direction Dresden.

There are parking lots next to the street where cars can stop quite easily.
Waited for 2 and a half hours. Didn't get a ride to NÃ¼rnberg. Might be because it was Sunday. Caught a train in the end since it was 36 degrees outside
We (2 girls) waited for 15 minutes before we got a ride to NÃ¼rnberg.

Nice spot for going to NÃ¼rnberg!
There's a bus stop where cars can pull over. Stand between that and the traffic lights, so people can see you.
Wanted to go to munich but most of the cars here just drive to Ulm, so we walked to another spot
good possibility to stop for cars going to Stuttgart.

I didn't want tk take the public transport because I was only going to the harbor. I walked and hitchhiked and a guy took me and was kind enough to drive me to the harbour even though he wasn't going there.
i life here...never saw a hitchhiker on that spot..mazbe better take tram 4 to dierkow until last stop and try there behind the bridge over the A 19

a good spot to reach almost all beaches (please build a sign with a name) on 'ostsee' (eng.: 'baltic sea') east of rostock such as 'darss weststrand', 'prerow' or 'zingst penisula'. also good to find drivers that take you to 'stralsund' or even further to the island of 'rÃƒÂ¼gen'.
We couldn't find anyone to go to Magdeburg-Berlin, but there were many people heading northern (-> Hamburg)
First person I asked took me to Hamburg. Good spot to ask people directly.

Great if you go north or south, hard if you look for a car towards Berlin. In my opinion it's always better to talk to people infront of the restaurant instead of standing with sign or thump.

- If you want to go from here to Berlin I recommend you to take a car northwards north until you are north of A2. Shortly after exit 54, GroÃŸburgwedel at 52.504431, 9.824794, you can get off and go over a bridge to a resting area for cars going south. There it is easier to find a car heading towards east.
senseless try to go to berlin from this point, i waited 6 hours and then decided to walk to lehrte
big rest area but not very much cars around 11 in the morning, hard to talk with everybody so its better to stand here before the cars go on the highway.

We tried to hitchhike a ferry to sweden which is possible but not super easy from here. We were standing in front of the check in gates. Cars are waiting  in line there so you can talk to the people if they take you. We asked the employees of Stenna lines ferry company and they told us that the number of passengers matter and people were also showing their passports to them. So it seemed like that with stenna lines it does not work. to hitchhike. But maybe the workers did not really say true and

I walked to the "toll" and tried to speak to people there. After one try the cashier send me away saying I was not allowed to hitch in the harbour area. I tried with thumbs further up the road then, but didn't get a lift. Bought a ticket for 13â‚¬ then. Check-in closes 30min before departure.
Maybe you could try to bypass the toll and speak to people when they are waiting in front of the ferry. But I didn't try that.

Arrived at the harbour, asked the staff on where I could hitchhike, a guy told me to go at the "toll", there I asked the cashier, he let me hitchhike. Very few cars so I went to ask people directly, got a ride in the 1st ferry straight to the next ferry in Denmark to Sweden!
Free ferry: The ferry charges by car not by passengers (max. 5 persons) so that your lift won't have to pay extra for you!

This spot is placed WRONG. The whole pier area is prohibitited for pedestrians! For hitchhiking see the two points below: the Ferry Ticket Center or (even before the Ticket Center) the roundabout.
Attention: currently (Sept'12) both Open Street Map an Google Maps  are not up to date in this area. Only satellite view of bing maps shows the right buildings and streets!

On a Monday at 1200 I wanted to go north on A7 and waited 1h22 for a ride.There's hardly anyone going north, everybody is going to NRW or The Netherlands or Belgium. 
If it looks bad, you can also accept offers going south on A7 - and go 30min/50km to the next Serways, 'Ohrenbach West' and walk 2km from the west side of the serways to the east side, 'Ohrenbach Ost'. That would increase your travelling time by 1h20min.
I recommend being aggressive from the very beginning and having a backup opt
Had to wait about 20min til I got my lift to KÃ¶ln
it's hard to get to the A7 from here. try to convice people going into WÃ¼rzburg to take you to the first small parking on the A7 and then go into WÃ¼rzburg from the North (exit WÃ¼rzburg Estenfeld)
Don't try it to hitchhike from there northwards the A7, waited like 3 hours to the next station at the A3 and after another 2.5 hours decided to go back to NÃ¼rnberg/Feucht
on the way to frankfurt very good. to change to the A7 towards the north, very difficult to find someone
The cars here go way to fast to stop. I waited very long and finaly gave up. Had a friend from NÃ¼rnberg bring me to RaststÃ¤tte NÃ¼rnberg Feucht Ost by car. From there it was easy.
You can stand under the highway bridge and thumb when it's raining. Drivers who drop you off at this point can park and turn easily here.

Take the S-Bahn to Fischbach, then there is an easy walk (10 minutes) to get on the bridge. The cars are going pretty fast there, but someone picked me up before I showed my sign, and took me to Pegnitz (the way to Berlin).

you have to catch a driver who can pick you to this spot. If a driver doesnt go your direction, but opposite is also good, you need just take a walk 80m (or he can easily turn back also). Dont try to get there from trian station by foot (its 2km, and no a sidewalk, nor bicycle path)
Girls be carefour, i heard from locals there is a meeting sex place.

It's a great place for getting to Berlin.
I always hitchhike to this spot from the center with a sign saying "Fischbach". Using public transport is a lot easier of course ;)

I wanted to go to Heidelberg. It was already dark and it was Saturday... A group of several polish truck drivers were sleeping there until Monday, going back to Poland. Asked around for about 1.5 hours, almost no traffic, so I decided to settle for a ride to Karlsruhe and catching a train to Heidelberg. The spot should be good, but my timing and luck were bad.
Asking around should work, in my case I was pretty unlucky with the weather and full cars. Eventually decided to sign at the on-ramp and was got a ride to Heidelberg within five minutes.

Found a trucker to take me east onto the A8 within 15 minutes.
The ride itself wasn't great as he took a 45 min detour to get some fuel and then got stuck in a traffic jam for 2 hours, but in the end we got to Sindelfinger Wald.
Thumbing at the exit with a sign "Heidelberg" i got a ride in 10 min to Bruschau.
I was lucky to catch first driver to Bad Sobernheim)
It was super cold and all the people went to nearby places. Also very cold (-1degree) so not very comod
We were 4 people and devided into 2x 2 people groups. the first group got a ride after 20 minutes, and we got one 40 minutes later so all in all 2 rides per hour. between 9 and 10 o'clock.

a guy from solingen left us (guy and girl) here. She was standing at the entrance to the autobahn (there is a small place for cars to stop) and i was at the traffic lights more ahead. Got a ride to frankfurt in 5 min. it was 3 pm

I got several rides there in direction of Frankfurt within 10 minutes. But once I waited there as well 1,5h and then got a ride to Konigsforst. I don't recommend this place during rush hour (local traffic) - e.g. 7am - About 10am it is fine.
I wanted to hitchhike south the A3 but after I waited like about an hour and a half i left the place and went to KÃ¶nigsforst. I really can't recommand this spot

Got ride in less than 20min to petrol station between Wismar and Rostock.
I recommend to ask people at the station for a lift

Had to jump the fence tho and walk next to autobahn

It took me less then 15 minuts to get  out of this place. is a great place if u are landing or departing from lubeck/hamburg airport. the way to arrive to this place from the airport is simple, turn left at teh exit of the airport , fallow  K8 you will walk wulsdorf, turn left at the kindergarden and keep walking untill you reachthe overpass, on the top of the over pass you can choose directions you need to jump the fence.!!there  is a bus stop in Wulfsdorf. i manage to get in to poland from her
VERY bad for the autobahn, good for ribnitz etc
10pm, and already dark, got a ride after 15 minutes to Recknitzniederung where we got stuck for the rest of the night.
January 2014 - cold,wet and very bad
there's a bit of a shoulder before the bridge, can't really stand at the on-ramp proper.
the best spot i was able to find in GÃ¶rlitz (even though its not perfect by any means)

Saw this on hitchwiki when looking for GÃ¶rlitz.
Really good spot, very nice woman took us all the way to Wroclaw.
...after half an hour of hitchhiking we got a lift when we were just walking towards the motorway.
Not enough space for cars to stop and quite fast traffic.
On a holiday (Karfreitag), so not to much traffic. Eventualy got a ride to Hannover in a touring bus.

I use this spot a lot with mixed results. If it's to busy people don't stop because the entry isn't very wide. In this case don't be to picky and take the first ride you get to Isselburg (10km further). This entry is much wider, but with less trafic.
Didn't get a ride on a Thursday evening
Nice for go to Munich, loads of cars go there. Burger King area is the best point for asking. Time waiting: 15 minutes aprox. on Sunday!
Just asked a quite young guy who looked sporty for a ride to Munich and he offered me Augsburg. Many cars there!
Good place to go to Augsburg or MÃƒÂ¼nchen. This service area has a gas station and a Burger King.
Great spot to go West, but we got catch to Hamburg
I was lucky here. This guy volunteered to takeme out of the Berliner Ring to the highway I needed to hit!

I guess I was lucky. I arrived here around 23.30, the patrol station was almost empty, but than a car stopped and I saw on the licence plat they were coming from Magdeburg. I could join them to Magdeburg.

Am Fichtenplan Nord, A10. It seems that most cars here are locals going into Berlin after refilling fuel. The best from here is to get a short ride to the next station Michendorf, where there's a lot more long distance traffic, both to Magdeburg/Hannover as well as Leipzig.

We stood in front of goodbye sign in the end of the rest station. There were lot of families and full cars, so lot of people canâ€™t take us but then take us one old pair. I think it is a good spot, but maybe we were lucky.

Small reststop, no petrol station.. not so many cars. When I was there, many people heading towards Hamburg, some going north but not so far. Still I was picked up by some old norwegian hippies. They were so sweet!

I was headed to Rostock to catch a ferry to Denmark. MANY cars headed to Hamburg, not so many north.  I would recommend getting dropped off at the station BEFORE this one on the A24 where there is also a gas station. This one is only a restaurant and is mostly families with a full car.

RaststÃ¤tte Wittstock/Dosse

Berlin--North
  Last one before turning towards Rostock.
I was so happy and lucky to get a ride from here to Dresden.
difficult to get a ride to the north (Heilbronn)
tried to get to Munich but people were rather just driving a few kilometres...For going further north it might be good but for going into the direction of Munich, prefer Sindelfinger Wald
to go to north its the last petrol station before the A8 crosses the A81, but its not much traffic here, so prefere the resting place near Rottweil, about 50 kilometeres before that station.
Trying to go to Czech, saw a few CZ plates but no one picked me up!
you should be lucky to find a car here because it's forbidden to stop here for Germans

Got the tram from city centre to "NÃ¼rnberger Platz" and walked to the Busstop. Within 2 minutes got a rid in the evening by a Czech couple heading directly to Praha.
In the night the place is fully illuminated, so you can hitchhike from that spot at any time without appearing myterious.

there's a bus stop right after the intersection. it has the advantage of cars coming from 3 directions and just after the red light, so the traffic isn't that fast. still, i waited an hour to get a ride to prague.
Not much and mostly local traffic. None going to Frankfurt. In the end a truck driver took me to hasselberg petrol station further south on the A7.
We were trying to get west but we got south. Big place with gas station anf McDonalds. It looks like there are many cars but there is not so big traffic.
not the best place to get southern (A7), but worked out!
as the Rasthof Kassel in august  2012 was still closed i came to the Autohof (shell) petrol station and the first car driver asked took me to Karlsruhe. Very good
Great spot if you're going to Munich or South to Austria. Germans stop here to buy the Austrian Highway Vignette so you can easily talk to them

Don't try to go west. No one goes to the west and no one goes to munich. Had to take the S-Bahn to munich.

 Might be a good spot to the south and especially towards Austria though
Got a ride to Salzburg after two hours...but it was a public holiday in Germany so a lot of families with no room in cars.
I could find a ride toward south very as late at night as 11.30pm!
It is an ok spot to go to A5. But it is difficult for cars to stop there. Just put A5 on your sign and eventually someone took me to A5

Much better spot than the one further to the East. Unlike the other spot, the parking lots are never blocked due to a zone of "absolutes Halteverbot". That makes it much easier for drivers to stop.
Also, drivers are less likely to be blocked by truck traffic on the right lane, and the can change lanes more easily and safely.
Sign is highly recommended, as traffic can go north and south on the A5.
Look for a ride that takes you at least to the next service station on the highway.

A guy and a girl without a sign on a Friday at noon. There is a bus stop for cars to stop, not ideal as everybody goes a bit fast, but probably the best spot to get out east of the city as there are a lot of people passing by.
Technically good stop, but for the way accross Germany to Luxembourg which was our goal. We were freezing and already giving up when a guy took us to better gas station.
Very nice gas station. I slept there in my tent. Next day I packed up early and got a ride from a truck driver after 30 mins just standing at the exit of the gas station.

there is not a lot of long distance traffic except for people leaving the airport after their flights. most of the drivers are locals or airport staff. i think immediately after a flight comes in is good, but you might have better luck talking to people on your flight or outside the terminal. still its definetly doable, i got a lift nearly to mainz early in the morning not long after the first or second flight arrived. if your flight is late and you dont want to hitch at night there are plenty o

Walked down to this spot that included cars exiting car park. Was not going to pay more for the coach than my flight cost from the UK. Had a sign "MAINZ/FFM BITTE" - Waited just over 12 mins, got a ride straight to Mainz - satisfying overtaking the over-priced coach 15 mins after it passed me!

I came from Berlin and wanted to go near Hamburg, but my lift was going to drive to Rostock, so i had to decide between this an the next rest stop before Wittstock. I went here, because this was a quite big one. I waited around 1h before a guy took me all the way to Hamburg. You may have to wait a bit even in easter holidays, but there are many cars getting fuel or people eating burgers.
Good spot, there's space on the side for loading and unloading (was empty for us) and cars go slow after the red light.
We wanted to go to Belgium but Nietherland is still good
Good traffic flow, good visibility. Easy to get to via bus

There was a lot us so had to wait in the queue for about 3 hours,  but once it was our turn to hitch took 30 min for a lift to a big service station and from there super easy to get a ride to Munich. Everyone waiting in this spot got rides to Munich or to the big service on the A8, might take a while but definitely worth waiting if your destination is Munich

Originally I tried to hitch from the petrol station just down the road from this bus stop. However, early hours in the morning, it was absolutely empty (although the first guy offered to give me a ride, but going down the wrong direction). Tried to take the bus to the on-ramp of the autobahn, but while waiting for the bus I managed to hitch a ride. Got incredibly lucky, went all the way down to near Milan!
Right before the highway. There was a police check for cars getting out of the roundabout. Stood right behind, and cars were stopping all the time. Best spot in Singen
Not a lot of cars pulling in, you will have to go ask them rather than just having your thumb up at the exit
a lot of traffic (midday), easy to get rides to hamburg and further
Wouldnâ€™t recommend this place not a lot of traffic. Been there a couple of times and the last time I left by train to the next gas station, just 20min by train. Way better place

A guy and a girl on a Thursday afternoon without a sign. After getting there by bus & train and walking about 25min, we stood at the first exit, where you get all the cars going both to the highway or to the petrol station. A lot of cars passed by, but we shortly got a ride to Heidelberg. Seems to be a good spot to go north.
Quite some cars
Really small traffic. I was lucky and had a ride to Freiburg with a fire truck after 30 minutes. Gas station on second side Is similiar, also bad traffic And past time after 3 hours I gave up.
Quite good spot, even on quiet days. Girl alone took me around 20-30 minutes. Both asking people and just standing around with a sign.

I waited for almost three hours, met a French hitchhiker, and together we got a ride in a French camper to Copenhagen.
This gas station has an outdoor water tap, which is very convenient on hot summer days.
Not sure if it is actually a good spot but literally the first person asked brought me all the way to Hamburg.

Wanted to go (Me+girl) to Berlin (over Hannover) on a Tuesday 15:00. Waited 3 h. Then changed plans to Hamburg because everyone was driving there and waited till 20:00. Then we sadly drove back (over OsnabrÃ¼ck) to Essen. Really bad for East over Hannover. Definitely okay for further north.
even to find a ride inside to osnabrÃ¼ck was very hard ! even that it was RUSH HOUR -:. was so hard to get from there to find a way to osnabrÃ¼ck
It was a sunny day, easter holiday (not so much traffic) at around 16:00. I asked the first couple at the door of the restaurant and they took me. It depends on your luck

Tried going in the direction of Aachen. But had no luck. Maybe it was because it was a sunday. Its probably better to take a bus and a train to the first gas station in the Aachen direction, its a short walk from the train station.
That was horrible, NOBODY toked usâ€¦in the Afternoon
perfect spot, catched to Aachen in 15 minutes
Perfect spot to Bonn. Stand right at the exit of the gas station and got a ride in 10 mins. On a Thursday afternoon around 1pm

A big petrol station, cars are stopping very often. Had a bad experience with getting to Bonn, I guess it depends from good timing. For Bonn you should look for cars with ''BN-...'' number plate, ''K-...'' usually stays in KÃ¶ln. People often going to Aachen.

I asked people if they are going direction Denmark. A lot of cars going that way. Had luck and found someone who took me all the way to Copenhagen. Recommend to switch here if you want to go further North.
Hitched here for an hour in the evening and got picked up by a polish truck driver, who drove me north of Hamburg, good spot
Gas Station. We had to cope with few traffic northways.
i guess i'll use this place when i go north to switch from A7 to A1.
this is a good spot for hitchhiking in both directions on the a7.
Horrible spot, had to ask even the truck drivers until finally someone agreed on taking us. Was midday even.
I waited 30 mins for a car across the border to Austria. There were many cars going to Austria, but most of them were full.
My friend arranged a ride from here to Budapest almost before I was back from the toilet!
Rest Stop "Jura".

Update July 2025
Roadwork is still going so this spot doesnâ€™t work, traffic is redirected. I would recommend going to Stople raststÃ¤tte

There is roadwork here in 2024-2025 which redirects traffic, I would not recomend this spot not. I waited a long time and almost no traffic. It's supposed to be done in May 2025. I would try another option, like Stolper Heide.
very good spot. However a lot of cars just turning to the gas station, there is a lot of place to stop. And mostly everyone who turns to the highway is going on the right line(there are 3 lines)
were extremely lucky to get a straightride to Rostock. Driver came to us straight. sign E 26 probably.. m/f morning
We  had a sign saying "A24 -> HH" and just waited for 10 min. 2 persons(m/f) friday noon
UPDATE OCT 2025: the entry to the highway is still under construction and it looks like its gonna take long until its done. bc of that its a terrible spot rn with almost no traffic
Right now the road to leipzig is in construction and it is a terrible spot. Just with 2 buses (30 minutes) you can go yo a yet gas station that is a little bit south. Very good that one.

Took me (woman alone) extremely long to find a ride. I walked around the gasstation and stood at different places on the (cross)road. Also had a scary experience with a guy that had purposely stopped on the onramp so I had to decide quickly. Luckily I said no and 30 min later I was taken by a really nice Israeli woman. Maybe part of it being so hard was due to the fact that gas prices were not good there and there weren't many people at the gas station.

got a lift there quickly multiple times
once in the winter I didn't find a lift for over 1.5 hours and gave up

Good and crowded place, there are many options: stay by the road, ask drivers... It convenient to hitch-hike from here towards west and south directions. Also you can meet here a lot of other hitch-hikers in summer. The best option is to come here in the morning.
male in early 30s, alone, waiting with sign and asking people
Really bad spot to go to the West.

friday morning, around 11AM, July, going towrds Berlin
spent the night in my tent behind the station in a little patch of trees, very quite. loads of trucks and cars, i took me a bit to get a ride until the next gas station on A9
i was hitchhiking at the entrance of the highway since there were not many cars stopping for petrol, mostly for food/toilets (at least at this time)
a police car drove pass me and said nothing (its always my biggest fear)
station is good. expensive, but there are to
i agree that there aren't that many cars passing by, but i only had to wait there for 20mins on a cold november thursday
There's plenty of space for cars to pull over, but not much traffic, waited about 1.5 hours to get a ride to the A9
Tiny gasstation little traffic and many going north to Hannover/Gottingen. I had to go to OsnabrÃ¼ck. I did get offered a ride to Berlin tho.
Got ride to A44 after 15 min. Very small place.
Gas station, direction north to Kassel, A7, A44

A guy and a girl on a Monday evening with an arrow sign to get in the direction of Kiel and Hamburg. This is not the best spot, but I think it's bad enough for people to help you if you get here. We got a ride to Schuby (west of Schlewig) quickly.
Didn't like this one, too narrow, to rushy, but wtf, I got a lift in like 15 Minutes. Wouldn't recommend it though.
I tried to get to Berlin from Aarhus and here I got lift directly to Berlin after some 45 mins.

We tried to get to the A2 (East) just to get to Helmstedt (or, if lucky, Magdeburg -> Berlin -> Poland), but we didn't get a lift. Many drivers told us that they were heading Western or Northern though
You need a sign showing the direction you want to go or you can talk directly to the drivers at the traffic light.
Very quiet in the weekend, might be better during commute hours. We managed to stop someone on the ramp to Berlin.

Tried to get to Berlin from here on a Sunday afternoon. The place was almost deserted and almost everybody there was either heading south or into Hannover. I gave up after an hour and went to Garbsen, which was way more frequented, and got a ride there within 20 minutes.
There is an Aral gasstation connecting directly with the A2 to go east. So maybe there are cars going to Berlin etc. Take the local train to Jadekamp stop and walk the rest of the way.

Almost no cars stop here, the gas station before (total energies) is better as it's cheaper and everyone stops there. We walked to the highway entrance, lot of local rides but at least something to get out.

A second gas station has been built serving the cars going to Freiburg. Cars going to direction Stuttgart, Konstanz or Tuttlingen can be found in a reasonable time. I am from LÃ¶ffingen so it's perfect for me to have such an amazing hitching spot right in front of my door.
B31.Direction Bodensee, Bavaria...

Itâ€™s a small rest stop, thereâ€™s not a lot of cars stopping there (some people wait before picking up relatives at the airport and wait here so as to not pay for the airport parking), rather clean toilets if you have to pee. Asked all the cars I could (not many) and eventually got a ride to the airport not too far

Kleiner Rastplatz: Am Entenfang 
Toiletten, Polizei, Telefonzelle

Autobahnpolizei stÃƒÂ¶rt sich nicht an Trampern

GegenÃƒÂ¼ber Rastplatz Stockweg, weniger benutzt

ca. 45min FuÃƒÅ¸weg von S-Bahn GroÃƒÅ¸enbaum, lohnt sich aber fast immer. (Oder Fahrrad am Waldrand anketten)

Technically good spot, because you stay in pedestrian zone, at bus stop. Drivers have a comfort place to stop. But drivers think it's not necessary to take you, bus will grab you, that's what they think. But drivers who really want to take you â€“ definitely will. I didn't catch nobody, so I took a BOSS.
At Busstop good spot for cars to stop. Direction Schluchsee, Freiburg. Likely to get only short distance lifts.
Not that many cars, but got a ride from a first guy i asked that was going to Bremen
got a ride from here almost till osnerbrueck but not the best place
not so many cars but not the worst place ever

needed to get to A5 south, people ignored us or looked disgusted, lot of rich people and taxis. after some hours i decided to hide and let my girlfriend take the job. after a while some bolt guy offered blowjob to her, than marriage, but took us to the first gas station on A5 for free. (without bj or marriage). we slept at nearby field, 5km from airport to not to get killed

Lots of cars going through, but you mostly get ignored. Be prepared to wait. I first tried unsuccessfully with a card saying "Stuttgart", which is a bit too ambitious. Then I switched to a sign saying "A5 sÃ¼d". Eventually I joined with two other hitchhikers, who were going to Paris. I was taken to Karlsruhe by a German man. It seems that waiting closer to the ramp is slightly more effective.
Very bad spot Imho, fancy cars and taxis do not take. Others care more about which turn to take.
Got a car at the departure zone, right before the barrier, easy cause people have to stop
SchÃ¶ner Platz, jedoch auch sehr viele Leute mit Firmenwagen die einen nicht mitnehmen sollen/wollen. Aber nach 15 Mnuten gings weiter. Eing guter Platz zum starten.

We thumbed here with a sign for Leipzig for ~2hrs and didn't a lift. Its
's a difficult place for cars to stop and also on a wednesday there was pretty much only local drivers. Maybe on a nicer day or in the summer its a better but we had no luck. Later we went to the rasthof near nikolassee and got a hitch in 30 minutes!

Quite a while back and I wasn't very experienced, but this spot was the worst, I waited very long behind the planks, cars can't park very safely there. 
I don't know about the petrol station, but don't go to the ramp. Just drive over to Michelsberg if you can
Senseless spot for going north. Not much traffic at this gasoline station.
Very good spot! Never waited more than 15 minutes. I hitchhiked from here to Dortmund several times and most times I got a direct lift to my destination. :-)
got a ride after 30 minutes to a petrol station on the A9 in the direction to Leipzig

Waited there for more than 3h with a sing (KÃ¶ln), later i gave up and walked further west to Katharinenkreisel. Don't know why no one was stopping because i think its a good stop and everyone is heading to the Highway. There i waited only 20 minutes (Lucky) because there was not much traffic.

Came here to go south, waited 30 min. A woman came bye walking and said thats nonsense, no one is going south. "Look in google where it leads you if you want to go south." Yeah she was right. Pointed me to a gas station south of the main train station, good spot.

Apart from that probably a good spot for other directions, plenty of space to stop. You have to stand on the bicycle lane though.
Waited almost 2 hours with a sign "A5 SÃ¼d" on Sunday afternoon. Many cars just drove by.

after 2 min a guy took us (me and a girl at 14:00 on a cloudy sunday summer day) to a gas station direction kÃ¶ln. very easy and very busy, good place for cars to stop, good traffic. Totally recommend. Maybe I was lucky, but that's what hitchhiking is about, right? you have to be lucky and make your luck happen
About one month ago (Nov. '11) I tried to hitchhike from here but there was a building site so the cars couldn't stop there.

Pretty dead gas station, lucky rides exist. There is a pathetic little man working here who will take Pfand and then not give you money because if you found it on the station, technically it's their property.

Do not rcommend getting stuck here late, dead gas station, very few cars passing by and many going north, and truck drivers just coming to sleep. I got super lucky waiting at the exit of this Rastplatz as a Polish truck driving on the highway saw my sign for Koblenz and decided to stop at the exit lane of Rastplatz. He was able to drop me off as far as Werratal Rastplatz near Eisenach
Easy if u want to go north

Easy to find a lift to the north like cologne or bonn, much harder to find someone going to the east or frankfurt.
its an average at all.

seemed like a good spot to start towards Vienna, since you can adress people directly at the gas station and cars are slowed down due to road restrictions, but even though its connected to A94, most people passing by are staying in munich. But in the end we (2 guys) got lucky, so the spot itself is quite good.
My girlfriend didn't even manage to write a sign and guy stoped for us and took us to Linz
You can easily hitch at the entrance of the petrol station if you want to go to Passau. There are not many people stoping at the petrol station but if they do, you can go and ask them for a ride.

Waited for 2 hours with some cars being unable to take us because we were with 3 people. Originally the plan was ulm or Munich. The amazing guy that eventually picked us up went to Lindau via ulm.
Lindau is a village on lake Constance, the biggest lake in Germany and we decided to go along.

I tried it on a friday, 15:00. Destination: Muenchen. Lots of cars, most of the with number plates of Stuttgart, Esslingen, Waiblingen. I had to waite 1,5 h, but the person that finally picked me up said, that this is the point where she always passes driving to Muenchen.

I tried to hitchhike to Munchen on a weekday at 17:00 for 75 minutes. There was A LOT of traffic but very few cars had Munchen plates. 3 cars stopped, but niether went even in the direction of Munchen. Then, I just went and took a bus to Munchen for 8 euros.
depends on in which direction you want
lot of cars stopped, its a good spot but we decided to spend the night in the city
It is a good spot! Not all cars might go the desired direction but others will! ;)
probably the best spot to go north, going further up proved to be a complete waste of time.
At a road with a lot of traffic. Cars can see you quite late, but it is still okay. The good thing is that it is directly at a bus stop and a traffic light. So the cars can pick you up easily.
Good spot, especially right after flight

Right after the parkings, there are many cars going in all directions. In the 15' that i've been there, i had 4 cars stopping, 2 going west to luxembourg, 1 going south, and 1 going to east to Frankfurt (my direction). Thursday 14:00

he/she is right! be prepared that the airport might be dead at times and all cars are either fully packed or too snobbish to pick you up! same goes with (all?) other airports. I stood here 1 1/2 hrs with no success! (and the cool hotdog stand was gone, so no fun!;))

The airport itself is not a fantastic place to get a ride - walk 15 or 20 minutes out along the main road (heading south) and try at the B50 junction.
Alternately, when you are on your plane, ask other passengers for a ride...
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Hahn_Airport

I arrived around 20:30 on a Friday in summer, very glad for the free bathroom (not super clean but not too bad) and free drinking water. Had a bit of a hard time finding a ride into Nuremberg despite lots of traffic since most people were going to Munich. Found someone to take me to an U-Bahn station nearby (HerrnhÃ¼tte.)
I was just heading into NÃ¼rnberg (coming from KÃ¶ln) and immediately found someone who could drive off the next intersection and drop me off.
I had to wait a long time because all the people went for holiday to the Alps and I wanted to go to Passau.
A good place on the way to Munich/Vienna.

almost noone going to bremen from here, if you want to go to the netherlands, a sign with bielefeld helped me. try to get a ride to the westward highway from hannover as its quite annoying to do it after. dont take rides to hannover if you plan on going west!
Okay spot. Few traffic.

Not the best and not the worst place to get out of Hamburg. I went twice direction Hanover from here. Both times a truck drivers took me. Holding a sign or thumbing is not the way you will get a quick ride. Asking for a ride will do the job. This rest stop is easily reachable from metro-station "Harburg". Bus 443, 143 and 148 stop at "Sinstorfer Kirchweg". The rest stop is just half a click away.
Stood there for about 40 hours to direction Hannover. Not many cars, mainly trucks.

good visibility but sucks to stop. i think it looks quite different to how it was in the other reviews, had better success standing on the middle stripe even though its probably super illegal. eventually got taken to the big station down the road from where going towards the netherlands is much easier

I don't really agree with the spot made for hitchhikers. To much traffic and the pedeastian crossing is not really made for stopping cars. On the other hand I got of in 35 Minutes. A lot of cars from Winsen/Luhe drive past, so if you come up with a sign for the next gas station on the highway Harburger Berge it might increase your chances.

This spot is suposed to be made for hitch-hiking. Cars always have to stop because of the zebra crossing. Just first hlod your hand out and ask friendly where they go, if they open the window. 45mins waiting was on a sunday morning 7:45...
habe hier viele touren angefangen, bin zuverlaessig innerhalb von 20-40 minuten mitgenommen worden.
Waited here for 6 whole hours. The people barely speak any English and flee whenever they are approached. Additionally everyone is going to berlin, very few cars are going towards leipzig
Often difficult to find somebody to Halle, Leipzig or Dresden since most people go to Berlin. Probably the best place around, though.
we arrived here on a Friday morning and it took more than an our to get a lift to Berlin.

Rasthof BÃƒÂ¶rde SÃƒÂ¼d.

Good for Berlin, but for Berlin there's also a good spot in Magdeburg.

It might be worth to take the bus out here and walk to the service station if you want to go on the A14.
Great if you're going to Austria (either Innsbruck or Salzburg), many different gas station options to ask around

Wonderful spot, despite the customer service at the cafÃ©. Huge amounts of cars heading to south (mostly Balkan, maybe Italy too). Got a ride by asking people to Ljubljana, even though it was past midnight. Could've gotten to Bosnia as well by the same car.
A lot of people but nobody to take us. After 2h finally a road to Salzburg. But you could be lucky. A lot of trip to MÃ¼nchen or Innsbruck. A lot of families, no place in cars.

Got picked up towards Salzburg after 20 mins. I tried the gas station but I found that waiting here was the best option. Walk down towards the parking lot and back to give people more time to see you. There's also wifi from the burger king.
Not such a good spot as it seems at the first sight.
Police were nice, let me hitch from just after the border (where cars are slow). In the end somebody from the restaurant called me over after seeing me for a while. Easy to go direction Freiburg

I started two times from this place, first time it was very very difficult to find someone, we waited about 3 hours, second time was a little bit easier, but it took us also about 1 hour to get away from there. But it was both times on weekdays, so many people are on the way to work and donÂ´t drive longer distances. Maybe on weekend its better...
After 2 hours during a night in summer (full cars) I got a ride all the way to Wiesbaden, near Frankfurt. I'm still grateful for the couple that took me with them.
we wanted to go direction karlsruhe but there were so little cars that after some time we decided to try another spot.

don't know if I was just lucky, but I got a ride after 2 minutes directly to Berlin from here. I think it's the best spot for everybody who wants to hitchhike large distances from Switzerland to the north of Germany
Very easy to get to Rostock and Denmark. At least during summer holidays.
It was easy 15 min. [with Rostock signal] a truck driver picked me up quickly

We were trying to get to Rostock, but most of the cars were heading to Hamburg. After standing here for almost 3h we crossed the autobahn and the first driver we asked took us to the outskirts of Berlin.
Last gas station before motorway splits in the two direction Hamburg and Rostock, mostly people who aim Rostock or Schwerin stop there, but I also got a lift directly to Hamburg.
Motorway service area. Gas station with a diner behind.
Got a ride to my destination Buddikate. A sweet young couple brought me there after I asked the man for a ride towards LÃ¼beck.
I guess not the best spot as other say, but we asked around and got ride to the better stop heading toward Denmark.
Waited about an hour on a Sunday (11:30-12:30) and got a ride to LÃ¼beck. I was standing at the Exit with a LÃ¼beck sign. I have the feeling itâ€™s not the best spot for LÃ¼beck but good enough.
I waited 40 minutes and found a lift straight to Berlin. Good place to go ask the drivers.
Getting a car to Berlin from didn't work! Better to find a ride into Hamburg and hitch from the beginning of A24.

Took us 5min to get to Kopenhagen from here. Fairly small gas station, but decent traffic. 
Probably worth it to ask around as most are heading to Puttgarden from here

Was dropped there at 8 PM on a Friday and it was pretty empty. Had to ask around and seemed most people were going North to the ferry at Puttgarden. Scored a ride all the way to Copenhagen, and would probably be better during the day.The worker there even gave me a free coffee!
stranded on a Sunday, lunch time. Bad choice :D <took an hour to get onto Fehmarn

I got dropped there at 15.00 a weekday. Not many cars, maybe 35-45 during the hour I waited. Several locals going only to Neustadt and many fully packed tourist cars. Some trucks come through here and finally a truck picked me up to MalmÃ¶.

As said before not very busy especially not on a morning, but never the less the best stop after LÃ¼beck if your driver is not going all the way up north to the ferry. Asked a friendly trucker who got me to Puttgarden.

A guy and a girl without a sign on a Friday at noon. We didn't have to wait for long before a girl took us to Manheim. It wasn't our destination, but we didn't feel like refusing as the spot is not ideal to stop.
Seems like a poor place, especially as the traffic light system is so damn efficient meaning the cars generally flow through. But you shouldn't be waiting more than an hour for a lift.

People do not see this little stopping space from their cars even when they stay on the red light, because it is a little bit higher than both streets are.I recommend to stay on  traffic lights, then if someone want to take you, he will just stop on the Mannheimer Strasse.
not much stopping space... but it's germany, bitches!

Depending on your direction it's a pretty good place to either get to Mannheim or North towards Frankfurt.
I tried making it to France (via K'lautern and SaarbrÃ¼cken) and failed miserably. I definitely wouldn't recommend hitching from here, but rather trying to get south on the A5 towards Strasbourg, that worked fine.
No longer a busstop here
To many HH
Did not see any bus stop there or any spot where cars could stop; luckily I was able to continue to another ramp
Excellent spot for going north towards Flensburg and Denmark! Almost no waiting time in early morning.
Excellent spot. Bustop offers plenty of room for people to pull over. Got a ride to kiel in 5 minutes.
Quite a common blablacar pickup spot in Dresden. we also managed to join a blabla group to Giessen
Asked people around McDonald's and Jet gas station - got a ride to Breslau/WrocÅ‚aw after 30 minutes.
