Needed to get to Zittau and got a lift directly there after 5 mins, asking at McDonaldÂ´s.

Seen lot of cars with B sign, some also with L. And got lift to Berlin in 5 mins with thumb at the exit from McDonald and petrol station.
For CZ and PL I guess it's possible to get ride to Dresdner Tor at the A4 and hitch from there
bad place for berlin at least. somebody took me to hansa straÃŸe. there it was much easier. so go there and dont came here

During night time itâ€™s totaly empty. 
And even during day timeâ€¦ We have waited for 7 hours.
Ok spot. Find a car to Kiel in an hour, but definetly not a lot of traffic. Nice wall at the end to sit tumbs up.
Little traffic toward North, but has a shop and benches to sit
and it is possible to get there and get away with a bus if necessary, or you can easily get there by foot.
Many going to Hamburg early in the morning, but found car after 1 hour at 8 in the morning. Also a fine place to put up a tent in the night.
Mainly local traffic but luckily it was a sunny day so we were snacking, asking, hh with sign. We got taken by a couple in campervan.
not bad

Many people are going south and north, not just to Saarbrucken, but it's the last restaurant before Kaiserslautern. After some 45 minutes a girl brought us to the spot on the exit number 10 - Aral station from where a guy took us directly to Paris.
I got lifts to SaarbrÃ¼cken or at least to the Rasthof RAMSTEIN or RaststÃ¤tte WALDMOHR. Looks calm, but absolutely easy-going.
Got a lift into Saarbrucken after approx. 30 mins.

It's an OK spot if you are prepared to wait. Lots of cars passing through but a lot of local traffic. If you are hitchhiking southwards, I'd entirely avoid going into central Karlsruhe in the first place. Stay on the autobahn, e.g. Bruchsal West.

Unsuccessful. It might not be a good spot to get a ride to the South. I did not find any to Strasbourg
But there are many cars and good space for a car to stop for you, which is a bus station. Cars come from a side road as well.
waited for a long time in direction to frankfurt. went then to the south entry of the central train station and asked people for a ride
the cars are really fast but it works if you are reallaxed - i tried to go to freiburg from there
Doesn't work for going North or East (Frankfurt, Nuremberg..), don't waste your time standing there..

We were waiting here in frozing winter and the guy pick us from there to the border of Poland.
Good place because people must waited on the red lights.
Not a good place to go in Poland, I've waited for 3h without results
I was standing here for 4h hours, then the police came to say that i won't have any ride here. And the rain arrived, i left to take a bus to Praha.
I was standing not exactly on the ramp but 20-30 meters before. There was plenty of space for cars to hold, and got a ride all the way to Dresden within five min.
Not a bad place. I got a car from here to Dresden.
The location is not that good, but we were lucky enough to get a ride by asking a couple of guys with a Luxembourg license plate. (1 M, 1 F)
good to talk to people at the shop/McDonalds.
Good spot for SaarbrÃ¼cken (A6) and Trier/Luxembourg (A62)
been there twice the first time I had to wait about 20 minutes and the second time I have been there for about an hour. Both times my destination was SaarbrÃ¼cken
april 2012 - bad ; it was freezing ! i was trying to get to trier, waited 2 hours, then i changed my sign to saarbrÃ¼cken, and had a lift quickly ; but it was freezing
Should be able to find cars going directly to Dresden.
i think its a good place with thumbing too, just stand on the ramp
This place can be really lonely. It looks so huge, but there wasn't a lot of traffic coming through. I recommend asking people directly, not thumbing.
well not much traffic, but in these  cases there was also not that much traffic on highway, don't know what i should think about

I have been here two times and both times this petrol station revealed not a good place where to switch drivers - fuel supplied by Total, it's a bit more expensive than other companies and this explains a bit why both times I have seen so few drivers in this spot. I recommend to avoid it if it's possible.
Couple with a panel indicating Ulm. Not so many cars but we get caught immediately :)

Huge station: filling station + resting area + restaurant, we tried at the exit on Saturday afternoon. A huge amount of cars passed by, mostly going to the North (we were heading to Stuttgart), mostly full-packed and Dutch. From here going North is OK, I think, but going West seemed impossible. After 3 hours we decided to hitch into Munich centre and get to the beginning of A8 highway by public transport, which is straight way th Stuttgart. It was a good idea! 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), S

Oct 15; waited here for 2h to get a lift further than Munich. Many were going to Munich.
ask people on the restarea ;)
Got a lift to augsburg in 1 hour. Try to stay on the A8 instead of A96. Good spot!
Me and my girlfriend wanted to go in direction to Stuttgart, we got a lift after 10 minutes. Calm and shady place, ideal for hitchhiking.
Solo woman with sign for Stuttgart picked up within minutes. 14:30 on a Friday, September 2025. Stood at exit of roundabout for Stuttgart.

From here its possible to hitch to Stuttgard or Munich (two different exits of the roundabout), but there is mostly local traffic (should be easy to hitch to Ulm).
We tried to get to Munich and had a sign, but it took us a while. Try to find somebody who takes you to the next gas sation on the A8 in direction of Munich or better donÂ´t get dropped here if you want to go to Munich :)

A lot of local traffic going north. Ask the people at the Burger King parking lot or the gas station, that's where most of the people from the A8 go to in my experience. If you need any infos about the busses etc. go to the reception of the hotel. The two receptionists were pretty friendly and helpful and seemed to be used to the sight of hitchhikers.

Rest area just behind the exit from the motorway (also indicated on the sign on the motorway).

There's a big parking area, a hotel, a restaurant and a petrol station.
On the other side of the road there is a bus stop (at the side where cars drive towards the motorway).

Much local traffic, many drivers stop for the night instead of going further.

Getting a lift into the direction of Stuttgart works.
But into direction of Munich there's almost nobody.

Hitching to the city of Ulm should work, j

Quite hard to get to the spot from Bremen. first you take the bus and then you hope for the best (you have to check if the doors to highway next to the bridge are open). Got a ride to Hamburg pretty quick tho
Not much traffic here but we got lucky by asking around and got ride to Hamburg.

Not super busy: it's just a parking lot with some toilets, benchs, and trucks. Got lucky and was offered two rides within 10 minutes. The first was going the wrong way for me and the other took me straight to Hamburg.
Actually a bad spot, but better than anyplace in Bremen for getting to Hamburg.
Not much space for cars to stop, also there's not much traffic. Nevertheless I managed to get a ride really fast.
Got picked up quite fast on Sunday morning. Not a lot of traffic on Sunday at least

-> A4 / EAST (Dresden)
I got dropped off in this exact location by a local guy who always uses this place for hitchhiking himself.
Not a perfect place - the side of the road didn't seem wide enough for car to pull over at first glance, but as I didn't see a more suitable spot I stayed in this place, and eventually got a ride to Dresden.
We tried it at the Goldene Bremm at first but the police was patrolling there. Solid spot but we waited around 2,5h for a lift to Strasbourg.
This gas station is actually several hundred meters before (towards French border) than it's marked here!
We asked 2h hours at the Gas Station..Quite impossible to go to Metz on a Monday Afternoon. In the End  the RaststÃ¤tte "Goldene Bremm" with a Sign worked out (after 5h in total)

Directly at the gas station next to a McDonalds.
Stand here with a sign to get to the peage direction Metz
Very few cars around 19:00. Mainly trucks, but shopworker offered to take us to Roermond after her shift ended.
Rainy Sunday Afternoon - people going to Roermond (but not beyond) or staying in DE. Picked up by Dutch people driving towards Eindhoven via Venlo.
A lot of fairly local traffic. Many people going to Roermond and no one at all going to Venlo. We were asking people for ages.
Rasthof Cloerbruch Nord A52 toward Viersen and Roermond (NL), petrol station plus restaurant, average sized carpark.

150m before this one thereâ€™s a junction where two traffic lights are, and traffic comes not so fast, with good visibility of you. Although, cars donâ€™t have a dedicated spot to stop. They would need to go mount the bike lane to stop for youâ€¦ 
I assumed if someone would like to stop he would do so, and someone did took me to wetterau gas station after 20 min of standing here with sign: A5 Nord
But they would have to be determined. You may get some offensive signs lol.
Some drovers are too fast here, but it is still the best place on this street to get an autostop to the A5. Don't listen to local grandma, who would tell you to go to the Shell Station ;p
Update: it is better to hitchhike about 150 m before Lidl since the cars can better see you and also have the possibility to stop.
Good spot to hitchhike to the A5 (north). You definitely need a sign! Hitchhike just before the entrance to the Lidl.
Hotspot !! Was trying to go to CZ and I arrived there on a saturday at 17h30. Got picked up by a friendly trucker who left me on the A6
Terrible. Many delivery drivers that leave their warehouse. I was going direction reseinburg
To east, but better go to Amberg and from there to Czech Republic

We hitchhiked to Prague from this spot. It tooked a 2 and half hour to stop a car went directly to Prague. Most cars are locals (who will not take you very far) or truckers (who canÂ´t take you anyway) I think a better way to go to Prague is to hitchhike to the petrol station "OberpfÃ¤lzer Alb South" (use sign "Amberg") from here and then from the petrol station to Prague.
Couple with a panel indicating Ulm. Not so many cars but we get caught in 20 min.
We got a lift to Stuttgart after 5 minutes on a sunday afternoon.
What do you mean by Â»the cars drive just too fastÂ«? Itâ€™s an autobahn service station. :)

Not very good to hitchhikt, the cars drive just too fast.
I waited each time more then 30 minutes
Melle-Ost on-ramp, roundabout with sufficient space on the exit towards the highway, great for getting rides to the service station 3km ahead or further (Bad Oeynhausen). Traffic drives slow.

A guy and a girl on a Tuesday morning with an arrow sign pointing to Hamburg/Kiel and a "HH" sign. This spot is good in theory, but there was only local traffic or people that ignored us. We also tried the other side of the road, further north, but it was also bad, even though there were more cars going to Hamburg.
Opposite to a busy parking and enough time and space for cars to pull over! A lot of trafic to Kiel I guess, also enough to Hamburg.

We got there in the middle of a Monday afternoon and there was only one car on this big parking lot... Maybe it's good if you ask the truckers, but we asked our driver to get us a bit south instead, at the Scandinavian Park, even though it was not that good either...
A group of 3 got a ride almost to Redensburg here. (09.2014)

Waited here to get a ride to Hannover but didn't work. Almost everyone goes to Hamburg so we took a ride to there instead.
Would recommend not to try to Hannover from here

i was here twice at night and once it took me just thirty minutes towards Hamburg and once it took me 7 hours towards rostock... but it was on a night where berlins soccer team was playing so everyone was at home watching the game
Exit no. 30 from Berliner Ring. Didn't take long to find a ride to Hamburg. Probably a good place to ask your driver to drop you, if they're going in a different direction.
It looked to busy but I was gone in 2 minutes.
Still not that bad, there's some long distance traffic here because of the nearby Autohof.

Not much space to stop cars, no hard shoulder. Cars coming from 3 directions, so it's hard to ask. Maybe try it on the space under the bridge or at the nearby gas station. Not recommended to stand directly at the ramp.

A super shitty spot, didn't get even 1 km lift over 3 hours in the afternoon.
Finally a thing were DB is more trustworthy then an average German.
Don't go here, save your time.
They will wave you crazy
Got a ride to the next gas station. Fast pick up, but for me not a ride to the next city.
This is a restplace, an extremely good hitching spot. If someone offers you a ride to the nearest gas station, think twice, because this is almost too good a spot to lose!

Perhaps it was bad timing given we were here on Monday afternoon, but there was close to no traffic and everyone was local. After waiting for an hour, we moved more south and got better luck from there.
Probably a lucky ride but it was a good spot for us. Two males. The previous review said all there is to say.

April 2023 - Group of three. Stickers of Trampennen and Bummit hitchhiking race, so a well used spot. This spot has cars parked all down the side of the road so can make it tricky to be seen. Moving away from the services down the road a little made the difference and we got a lift in around 40 minutes. However we did struggle with the Irschenberg services where we left. Check out what others have said for it as we did not leave until the next day.

A fairly bad spot for hitch hiking, but maybe the best spot in this tangled mess of highways around DÃ¼sseldorf. 

There is no place where you can stand and catch most of the traffic from the car garages, or the people going to the car garages, or people dropping off for departures. Car traffic for arrivals, departures, taxis, and valet service are all mixed together. Exhausting, but doable. Lots of local traffic but also lots of traffic for long distances in all directions. 

Hold out for a

I used this place few times, when i went to Netherlands and i had no idea how to get there. Take s-bahn 11, take right excit, then go left, there is traffic circle, under sign "alles richtung". You can stay on the striped area before split roads (one goes to hotel) or in the lawn in the last turn from traffic circle, there is no place to stop, but cars do it, because road is wide enough. I was waiting there first time about 20 minutes, the last one something about 1 hour.
kind of tricky getting here. you need to walk for quite a while past the highway. cars are already really fast when passing.
Can confirm that many people seem alienated by hitchhikers there, still better than Goldene Bremm

After waiting 1h30 to the gas station we decided to move to that place because everybody there goes on the highway leading east. Wait on the zebras, there is also a lot of place for the cars to stop and people see you for far away
Waited a little bit less that 1h. A lots of people but not really opened to take hitchhikers, they looked astonished to see hitchhikers there.
Waited for circa 127 minutes on sunday but no one picked me up. Held a sign that said west no dice
Got a lift towards the A2 thumbing on sunday noon within 15 minutes. Recommended!

AGIP petrol station. Good for westbound traffic on the A 2.
Friendly staff, very easy to reach with the tram (station "Albert Vater Str.) and they play nice music whilst you wait here. Good for asking people as well as for pulling people out with a sign on the kerbside.
Waited less than 30 mins even after 20.30h
2023 there is construction work on street before this spot, so there is no traffic going through here at this time. Street was empty.
Good place, becaus there is a smal street, where cars can stop easily. Of course, the spot is good for going north or south.
nobody going to nÃ¼rnberg, could be good for munich

Bad spot, the highway starts directly after the traffic lights, theres no place for the cars to park. Most cars are coming from the opposite lain, you have to wait for red lights. We ended up taking blablacar to cottbus and tramped from there
I have waited there in a saturday morning around one hour. There was not so much car. After that Police came and told me I cant wait on highway. For this reason I leave the spot.
to Dresden or Frankfurt
4 hours here and still nothing. Our journey through Europe was fast and easy and on our way back to Czechia we got stuck at this stupid place.
(Friday 16:30) very busy, got a hitchike to Karlsruhe after ten minutes
Petrol station HunsrÃ¼st. Quite big, but doesn't seems to be very bussy (Tuesday evening). Direction to Mannheim and further.
Not a good spot, somebody called the police on me because they thought it was dangerous, which I guess it is.
Kinda good place, got a car in 2 minutes, but driver said that previous hitchhiker he took were waiting there for 2 hours.

A guy and a girl on a Monday afternoon without a sign. There weren't many people at the gas station, so we hitchhiked at the intersection instead. Wasn't good : only one car stopped on an hour and it was local traffic, as were a lot of other cars passing by. We gave up and went a bit before the bus stop west of here; it was muche better there!
I got a sense that it wasn't the best spot, but I was extremely lucky to be picked up by a nice Spanish guy going to Hamburg Airport. For me, this spot worked better than the nearby Burger King.
Lot's of truck so maby better for single person but not for 2 people. After almost 3h We get lift to better spot behind Erfut. People didn't want take us even to Erfurt
Got a ride even at 10pm.
Got a ride to Stillhorn really quick after having a long distance ride from Trento with my new danish friends. Its good for going northwards on the A1/A7.

Avoid this rest area, talked with people, at some point also hitched but in 4 hours I managed to get noone, and it's not like there wasnt any cars, lots of danes here, but noone gave me a lift even to Hamburg, just try rest areas more south , didnt work out for me
I think i was crazy lucky i was with a friend and we didn't even have sign got a ride with a very german guy who couldnt speak english still nice!!!!
Most cars arent going south and small amount of space to stop. We were 2 people.
direct to dresden abort78

bad spot, cars there are going in multiple directions (A5-> Frankfurt, A7 north and south and A4 east), so its less propable to find someone driving in the right direction, especially if you're coming from Frankfurt.

I've been stuck in Frankfurt and after trying different hitchhiking spot in the city I would say it's the best one. I stand at the traffic light with a cardboard "A5 Kassel". There is also a gravel space after the traffic lights were you can go and people can see you. If you want to go North, you're best chance is to be drop at Getterau gas station.
I agree with another comment, doesn't feel like an ideal place to wait - not to much space for cars to pull over
Not an ideal spot, there's not much space for cars to stop and your in a turn. I think we got lucky to wait only 20 min
Mid afternoon. Waited for 2 hours beside road. Petrol station was too quiet to bother talking to people. Ended up getting bus elsewhere.
To GÃ¼tersloh

Probably a good spot if you stick with one plan. I constantly switched between asking cars that tanked and standing at the traffic light hoping someone would pick me up. In the end I got so desperate I even started asking the people that stopped at the red light and thatâ€™s how I got picked up to get into Denmark (7 to 8 am)

We were trying to join the highway to go to Hamburg 
You can ask people to drive you to the next gas station and hitchike at the entrance of the highway
Leave the cars enough space to stop for you and it is a great place to put your thumb out.
I was there in August on a Saturday evening. Astonishingly difficult to catch a ride to berlin in my experience. I felt a weird vibe and the people werent that friedlyâ€¦
They where only going into the city not in the direction of Bremen
Great. Not many cars but everyone was friendly and open to talk. Got a lift to the frontier with cz in 5 min :)

Getting here from the ferry is a hassle. Most people are local or driving north, I got a ride to Rostock central after half an hour by asking people at the gas station. If you want to hitchhike by sign/thumb its also possible, but you're probably better off just asking here, as there isn't that much traffic, and pulling over can be stressful here imo.

That's no good spot to catch cars to Munich. You'd better look for a car heading to Memmingen Ost. And even it is not that easy. From Memmingen Ost, where I stood before the on-ramp to Munic, I caught a lift in less than 15 minutes.

There were many cars in the south direction (---->Bazel, MÃ¼nchen)


Many cars did not stop for us, althought there was enough traffic.
Not the best, but really oke, lot of people stopt, but they are going to bremen. I needed to go to osnabruck. Later i decided to go to bremen to try another spot
We had a sign, spot isn't ideal for cars to stop!

No place for cars to stop, so you just need that one driver willing to take the risk and kind off  stop in the middle of the road. I found that ride and got to TÃ¼bingen pretty quick. Lots of traffic.

I've been drop there coming from north, trying to go west. I was in deep shit, my strategy end up taking a ride to munich, and stop on a gastation on highway 8 where I can go on the opposite site. It worked great, if you find a ride to Nuremberg you can do it to on the highway 6. 

If you just want to go south, then you're in the right spot.
Nice spot to go to Munich but bad spot to go east and to Czech Republic. Not so many cars here

On the side of the highway leading out of the airport. We were at the gas station a few meters down but an airport worker told us to try and get to the side of the motorway just behind. There's space for cars to stop. Decent spot for both north and south
I've hitched here several times; usually it works well enough to at least get to the first gas station in a reasonable time frame. Sometimes it doesn't, and sometimes you get a longer ride, too.
Waited quite a long time with the intention of going to Stuttgart or Frankfurt. Got picked up eventually going to Ulm. Would say its an okay spot.
There was a traffic jam on highway, cars was very slow, so I could stand on the highway and that was helpful
good spot, shop near by and bus station behind you. waited like 10 minutes

The spot is good but for some reason I was waiting for 3 hours until a guy took me to near Hamburg.

Thursday at 8 AM
Some traffic to SaarbrÃ¼cken but not a lot. Met a really friendly guy going coming back from work who dropped us off just before SaarbrÃ¼cken.

Stood next to the traffic light with a sign, seemed kind of hard to get a ride but after only 20 minutes a driver stopped at the mc Donalds and took us to the better sport right before A4. There is also a small gas station right next to it but very little traffic on Sunday

very specific situation bc i got here at 11PM, stayed the night and asked truckers in the morning. this area on the A20 is a little bit of a black hole, so this was the best option for long distance rides to PL. only a rest stop and a toilet so mainly truckers and some people stopping for a piss but a LOT of people going to poland compared to the big orlen a few km back. i got a ride from the third trucker i asked, 4 hours directly to poznan but most polish truckers don't take hitchhikers anymor
Hitch-walking

Last petrol station on the highway before entering the Netherlands. Don't get stuck here at night as there is nobody! I went to sleep in the Hasbruch Tower which is in a nature reserve about a 30 minutes hike northwest. Next morning it took me two hours to head towards Leer
Not even trying to hitchhike, a woman saw me walking on the side of the road to the bus stop and took me to Naundorf

Not a great spot, essentially 1 big onramp. Was relatively easy to stop because there was roadwork so there was space and cars were slow. Accepted a car north to the nearest RaststÃ¤tte and then crossed the highway to go south
Mid spot, not much place for cars to park but quite visible
Not a great spot, good enough to go to Strasbourg. Not much traffic but enough people go to the gas station.
OK spot if you are looking for a ride to the center to continue your journey. Obviously not good for longer distance.

Probably good for North, but I was going South. I approached a lot of people in the Burger King and people were either locals, going North, disinterested, or even rude. I had better luck at the nearby gas station, which is just a short walk away.
Got a Ride to a check boarder town
Not very much cars here. Had a ride to an Autohof from a super nice guy, who bought me an ice cream, and could've helped me with accommodation.
Okay spot if you wanna get to switzerland bad spot if you wanna get to france, here people only go to swiss
A bit Dangers. Lot of traffic and not a lot of space. But super easy to get into Hamburg from here.

asked people around on the ferry to rostock. most didnt want to talk with us, some were offended. even if youre very polite its kinda tricky, but its worth it. if you cant get anyone to take you with them you can also wait in waiting room in rostock and try hitchhiking with a thumb after cars get off next ferry

A lot cars going in the direction of France. Actually wanted to go to Colmar but still took the first ride we got even though it was not going there because we had to wait quite long.

Not much traffic here. There are some truck drivers, but well, we are couple, so not really an option. There was actually one creepy guy but we got quickly taken by two Syrians heading to Luxembourg, so all good.
We got dropped here by our previous ride but I would not recommend it here, it felt dead, so we just started asking people to take us a bit further and one girl took us after few minutes.
We waited at the bezina agip closer to Feucht, but then we decided to walk to the bigger parking spot and asked an older lady that took us straight away, was very nice
Good spot for westward travel, itâ€™s the main road. Busstation behind you for people to stop. Possible to reach A1 from here
no idea why would you ever need to hitchhike here (we had a very specific situation haha) but it's possible, mostly tesla workers coming home from their shifts. there's better spots (summer 2024)

After a while I had to realize that this wasn't the best choice, because the cars accelerace fast and have no real option to stop especcially due to the no-stopping-area coming after 500m. At first I just tried it by thumb but after some time I found a piece of
Enough space for cars to stop and quite quickly a man heading to NÃ¼rnberg took me to the gas station on the highway going towards Frankfurt.

The gas station wasnâ€™t too busy and the only ones there were not driving far, so I started walking towards the highway and the next thing I know a woman stops to ask if Iâ€™m hitchhiking somewhere as she had done it herself too and then took me closer to the highway entrance.
good traffic volume for rastplatz, mostly truck drivers
We tried to get a lift farther West talking to people, no matter if on the Northern or Southern side of the Bodensee. After 40 mins, we accepted a lift to Kreuzlingen to hitch from a better spot.
Decent spot to get a bit further out , walked here from the port, wait times of 20-50 minutes expected, but the least you will get a ride to Rostock
Good logistics but couldnt hitch a ride (possibly because it was cold and raining so i was wearing all black looking pretty scary ;))
Many Cars and drivers- good choice in You want to Go to the highway. In the southern direction it was difficult to find s.o.

Someone took a detour to drop me at other side of the border.
Hitched while hiking.
Hitched while hiking.

From the Mittfahrbank at Edeka. Tramprennen Easter Race. Just needed to get a ride anywhere, so we hitched a ride in a trailer to the other side of the road.

Walked here from the of-ramp. Very little traffic.

There's traffic lights here so you need to get lucky that a car stops and that you are standing in the right place to be able to make eye contact with the driver, they can't stop for long if the light turns green, but they can take a right and pick you up in de carpark.
Decent spot if you want to go in direction of OsnabrÃ¼ck (with one stop in between for us)
It was in the morning, I hadnâ€™t been lucky so far to get to this gas station, but after asking every car I saw coming in I finally stumbled upon a guy who could bring me almost to KÃ¶ln

Relatively good spot, you gotta alternate between the two roads (the lane that first crosses the road before entering the highway is the less promising one Iâ€™d say). Eventually found a car that started talking to me at the red light right before entering the highway and brought me to Kiel
You gotta believe in your luck if you wanna be dropped here. There were barely any cars there but thankfully the second car I asked helped me get on the highway 7 going north

Relatively good spot, cars would be able to briefly stop to pick you up. You gotta pay attention to both sides of the road so it does get tiring at one point, but itâ€™s a straight road if you wanna go to Bremen

I started on the parking lot asking around. But there were so few people that I decided to go to the drive in of the parking lot with my sign. There I got picked up within 5 min by a truck.

Should be a good spot- people can hold close to you and they are not to fast. Also enough people there. And they see you early enough. But take a good sigh with you and patience. Oldenburg is the next stop- so everyone is definitely going there.

Allot of cars- but not allot are going to the highway. Still a good spot because they can stop easily but be patient with German people ðŸ˜…ðŸ˜­
Not good position. Drivers go from the turn, they don't have time to react. No enough place for stop car. But this place is not prohibited by police. We were just lucky to have a car quickly.
There is a space under the bridge. Probably better in direction Biberach, but you could also try to catch cars going south on the main road.
Little traffic which is mainly all local, but fine spot for going to north, got a car with 30 minutes after walking out from Ermenrod
In front of the road into the parking places, lots of traffic, but hard to stop, had a sign for Mainz and finally in 30 minutes a car picked up, but honestly a really poor area for hitching

Decent amount of cars turning to the highway, mostly locals, direction north, there's 2 lanes that merge into 1 so the road is wide, but not the best spot for going a long distance, wait time of 30 minutes

Technically illegal, I was behind the bollards with a sign to Karlsruhe in a deep rain with traffic jam making the speed there to be like max 20km/h, got a car with 5 minutes, but probably wiser to stay somewhere else( unless huge traffic jams would happen)
Decent shoulder for heading north, but almost all of the traffic here is local, as well as density of the traffic was little, got a lift within 25 minutes

Seems like a decent gas station as well as LKW where the lorries were at, didn't find any active lorries (was late at night so didn't want to disturb them), gas station had lots of cars but mostly locals or going to France/Switzerland (I myself tried to go to north)

All along this road from Waldshut towards west direction didnt find any good spots, but this was where I got picked up after waiting for hours on anywhere on this road, I was here late in the evening tho, around 10pm-11pm so thats why perhaps, good luck

At the entry to the gasstation. First tried a sign "6km" to get to Garbsen, than "Osnabruck". Eventually got a ride to Auetal without using a sign.
... not even a toilet there! But itâ€™s better than it looks at first glance: Every few minutes someone squeezes their car in between the trucks for a quick pee break.
Not used to see hitchhiker but it worked to go to dormagen
Not many cars, fast cars and not very visible spot.
Not super safe, basically no space for drivers to stop but we found a ride nontheless in 5 min that took us to Rendsburg. Would not recommend going here but you can make it work in case
Not a best place, bit worked. No place for cars to stop.
Not a lot of car stopping here, I think I got lucky to get picked up after only 30 minutes
Wanted to go to Dresden, one guy took me the the East Cross. Very Lucky, but good Spot to get to the Highway.

The traffic here is pretty low, and most of it is going north towards Berlin or south towards Munich. Not much people going east. I think we got lucky. But we got a ride to the next service station after NÃ¼renburg. We had a sign A6 - east.
Not the best spot but its ok guy going to fehmarn stopped me after something over 30 minutes
Waited about 30 min on Sunday late morning. Got a ride to Halberstadt
Need to ask the people at the gas station for a ride

started at the intersection with the main road, but further into curve of the on-ramp cars slow down a bit more and can see you from reasonably far. reasonable traffic on a sunday morning. i'd say i got very lucky on this one, but finding a ride to the next petrol station should be doable!

Ok spot to get out of Zwickau but most of them is regional traffic

Totally agree with Ireneo!

Not the best spot, but somehow work

Not the best Spot nur we got Lucky and got a Ride to our final destination Leipzig for the day.

get a ride in wednesday 4pm just to another spot in 10 km to autoban around berlin . may be a good spot to go east in the morning, but that time everyone was going to the agglomeration of berlin .

3 Persons on the way to Harz mountains. 
our driver wanted to take us for 5ish km but decided he had time and kept talking and driving until Nordhausen :)

Great spot for short distances and small towns like Bad Abbach; terrible for longer distances or the autobahn.
People are super friendly and many cars stopped, but we were going to Munich and didnt want to get stuck in a small town 5km down the road. Finally after an hour crossed the road and hitchhiked further into Regensburg to another spot where we got a ride straight to Munich in 5 minutes.
Big bus stop, cars going slowly.

Was dropped off by a truck driver who was heading towards KÃ¶ln. There is a bus station but not too much traffic. But you an also take the bus to WÃ¼rzburg so not a bad place to get dropped of when the driver is going further on the a3 and WÃ¼rzburg is your destination.

the incoming lane from Am Hohen Kamp has enough space for someone to stop without blocking traffic. Not the best spot but workable if youre going to Uelzen.

Good luck!

you are visible, there is space for the cars to stop. Though traffic was very scarce even on a friday morning. in the end I got a very lucky ride all the way to Denmark, but i would consider the next shoulder '35' next time.

My rating is for Prague - Wanted to go to Prague - was surprised by how little traffic there was at 11AM on a thursday. There were maybe 12 cars, maybe a new one every 5min. Became a bit quicker later. I tried for 90 minutes and then called a BlaBlacar. 
I could have gone with a czech trucker, but I was worried about the language barrier, and was not desperate enough yet. If I did it again, I'd go for truckers immediately and try to get to the rest stop Varvazov behind the czech border.

Not bad, not great but I found something

Definitely would avoid this station. Took us 2 hours to find a ride, not even in the right direction. Honestly juste get the first car that will take you Somewhere else. But good spot for gotting to Cologne

took me a while to get north on the a3 because most are locals/ heading to the airport
Stand on the nearby bridge instead. More traffic!
Indeed not recommended for going north on the A3. Lots of local rides and some to Wiesbaden, Stuttgart, MÃ¼nchen etc.
There's a gas station where you can ask. No recommendation if you're heading north. Took me 3 hours.

Day one we waited for 4 hours, noone, so we went to the city, qhere sime nice people let us stay at their place, they even fed us dinner <33 Other day we waited 3 hours, weather was terrible and we were desperate, so we went to the front behaind guarding and picked up a guy going to Landau in 10-20 minutes
Saturday evening, we were 2 people going to Karlsruhe and Stuttgart. Very low traffic (approx. 5 cars parked), nevertheless got a ride directly to our places in 10 minutes.
Many people going south to Strasbourg and Switzerland but no one continuing on the A8 towards Stuttgart or Pforzheim.
for going to A8 to Pforzheim and Stuttgart its difficult to find somebody there and it is not many traffic here, waiting time between half an hour and four houres.
met two guys who wanted to go to the south to freiburg, they were standing there for more then two houres

Just stand at the traffic light. I got lucky pretty quick.
There is a traffic light, I just went asking people, and the first persona picked me up! He wa not going far, to the airport, but it was something
There is a traffic light, I just went asking people, and the first persona picked me up! He wa not going far, to the airport, but it was something
at the traffic lights, many people stop on the right lane to turn right onto the A9

We wanted to go to Poland on a Friday but after 1 and a half hours of waiting we decided to change the spot. There were only local cars going to Berlin or nearby areas. Only a few polish cars but they didnâ€™t stop. Also the place to stop for cars isnâ€™t perfect.

"Dresden" card and one guy which was going to Budapest stopped ;). Best of that 3 spots here, becouse people stay on red light at 'L752 and B 96a' crossing and can see u from there + very safely place.
Waiting with "Dresden" on paper, but we catch a car going to town Cottbus on the half of the way.

Spot for the direction of Dresden or Cottbus.

Rather good place to stop for cars.
Not a good spot, very few fars and most of them are locals.

Definitely the better choice than the other petrol station. Less people than the other station, but at least it's not just the desperate shopping housewifes who also need to fuel their car. If you pass by this area, I'd recommend you that petrol statin, maybe even mixed with an handwritten panel.
This spot is too narrow. We tried just a few meters west of here with an arrow sign amd it was much better!
Works really fine here, visited this Spot probably around 10 Times in the last year, never waited longer than 15 Minutes.
One of the better on-ramps: Cars are exiting the roundabout, so they are going low speed.

Direction Munich.

If you're going to Italy, I guess it's an option (but won't take you much further than Rosenheim if going to Munich).
direction Munich; gas station isn't there any more, but still the best place to stand at for this direction

don't like this spot but still the best option for going south. Gas Station owner usually forbids hitchhikers to ask around at the gas station but u can stand next to the road using a sign

the gas station Shell. didn't really worked for me... i waited for an our to get a lift to A44.. may be it was just bad luck

Busstop

Once have been "dropped" at the OMV station, it was no longer possible for the two of us to hitchhike on the A93 towards Regensburg. Through a conversation, we were able to get a lift to the McDonald's on the opposite side of the road and continue from there.

Here you will get all cars and tracks leaving the parking. You can even sit on the grass, becouse there are not many cars here but all of them are going for minimun +100 km distance.

Small highway stop, not many cars stopping - but good to catch a ride down South in direction Passau. Starting at try this spot in the darkness is senseless. Its reachable the spot from the IKEA Bus stop.
